We prefer the Palazzo to the Venetian.  Its a bit more staid, and upscale, and the clientele seems to be a bit more refined.  The casino isn't as crowded as the venetian, and it just seems to have a better, more classic "feel" to it.  Great restaurants, and promotions as well.

The rooms are just like the Venetian, just newer (on the whole).

One of our favorite places to stay in Vegas.  Great location on the strip, as well.  Huge pool(s).  Great people watching.

Of late the promotions have really scaled back...  Vegas must not be hurting anymore!

One of my best Vegas hotel experiences. The room is spacious with a great lounging area. The sofa folds out to be a sofa bed, so if you have unexpected guests, they wouldn't have to be on the floor. The bathroom is huge with 2 sinks, tub, shower, and vanity. The beds are fluffy clouds of softness. Try jumping on them, you get so much bounce that you feel your head's gonna hit the ceiling. The little 2 ft tall divide between the "bedroom" and "living room" makes a great catwalk where your girlfriends can strut their stuff and strike a pose before heading to the club.

Woo Hoo!  What else can I say.  Typical IHG Hotel.  Stayed on the 26th floor.  Great views.  Exclusive lounge with full breakfast buffet complete with smoked and marinated salmon, omelettes, cereal, yogurt in glass, fruits, pastries.  Then there's the drinks, most of which are included up to $14.  I had my fill of Black Russians, mimosas, etc.  She had margaritas, and other fruity spiked drinks.  We never bought a meal the whole time we were there.  The beds were so comfy, the shades went up and down with a touch of a button, 3 TV's.  The bath was huge with 3 separate rooms.  A real 6ft tub.  The LUX Bus stop is a 15 minute walk.  Great location.  Right across from the Fashion Show Mall.

I've stayed at the Wynn Encore, and I was hoping to stay again at the Wynn, but the conference I was at was at the Venetian so I stayed here instead.

I think that the Wynn is nicer and more upscale, but after spending several days at the Palazzo I ended up liking this complex very much. A very extensive complex with lots of restaurant and some pretty unique shops and a good gym\/spa.  

Next time I come I'll be hard pressed to decide whether to stay at the Wynn (slightly more upsacle but a little less to do) or the Palazzo. Maybe a few nights at each. 

Why I would not come back to the Palazzo - the constant Phantom of the Opera music in the elevators and the other crappy shows at the Palazzo.
Year of the rooster! We were wondering why the had a rock huge rooster inside the Palazzo.  You can get turned around easily.  We were parked at Palazzo parking but try to get our car at Venetian.

Probably the best casino in Vegas and the staff are superb!
The hotel rooms are the best as well.

I'm betting you only see 5 stars above, but if you squint really hard, you may see the actual 10 stars that I have assigned the Palazzo. 

First, let's talk service. From the moment you arrive, you will feel pampered. There is an expediter at check in, quietly ensuring that the process is smooth and pleasant. When you head to the pool, someone is eager to lay your towels out for you, and someone else is handing you ice water, and a third employee is giving you a sliced orange. When your visit is (alas) over, you'll be pleased to know that check-out is a delightful breeze. Is the bill incorrect? The error is fixed instantly, without even a moment's hesitation.

Now, on to the rooms. The bathroom is marble and makes you feel like an Art Deco movie star. The living room area is great for lounging after a long day, featuring a squishy sectional sofa, coffee table and ottoman. When you finally go to bed, after having watched the sunset, you'll sleep deliciously--the bed is comfortable, the pillows are great, and there is no noise whatsoever. None.

The next morning, start your day in one of the multiple pools and hot tubs scattered throughout the landscaped garden. Some are in shade and some are in sun, so--whichever you prefer--you'll be happy. 


The location is slightly more isolated than a mid-Strip hotel, but that's fine. There's plenty to do and good transit access. The Palazzo and the Venetian blend together seamlessly, providing for several hours of entertainment without having to brave the 100 degree heat outside. The Venetian contains a handy-dandy Walgreens, but if you need more, there's a skybridge to the mall across the street and the Deuce stop is right in front of the Palazzo.

Also nifty is that, as a hotel guest, you can skip the line, the bouncer and the cover charge at the attached Venetian's Tao club.

Since I had a 3-day weekend over the holidays we decided to drive down to Vegas to stay at the Palazzo on the 17th of Feb. This was my 3rd trip to V\/P in the last 6 weeks and my wife's 2nd. We were excited to do some gaming, reach platinum player status and have some good food. Sadly, the trip didn't go as planned.

The first night of our trip our suite was robbed while my wife was in the unit. From what we can gather is the door didn't close completely behind me when I left for a gaming session. Unluckily for us there was a doorpusher on the floor who came upon our door while my wife was in the bathroom and since I had just left not long before she thought I had just come back to grab something I had forgotten.

The thief proceeded to ransack our belongings until my wife called out my name and then he rushed past my wife out the door with her wallet. She immediately sent me a text and I came up to the room with security who then took a report and started their investigation. We were beside ourselves because her wallet had her passport, green card, drivers license and other incredibility difficult items to replace. The credit cards I immediately canceled and while there was some cash, she at most had about $200.

Security was great with following up with us and making sure we were up to date. We ended up lucking out and her wallet was turned in sans the cash but fortunately her documentation was still there. I'm still in contact with an investigator there as we work through making a report through Metro as they work on apprehending the person responsible, although he hasn't returned my call from 2 weeks ago.

My concerns were with my host. After I arrived at the room and determined exactly what happened I texted my host, he expressed shock and mentioned he'd come up to the room and asked if there was anything else he could do. I told him to call security to make sure they are checking the cameras, which he did. But he never came up to the room. I never saw him in person the entire trip after the robbery occurred.

Outside of me texting him asking how my play for the trip was for the trip I never heard from him. No offers to have our room changed, to send my traumatized wife to the spa (she initially wanted to leave right away, but mentioned we should stay around in case the wallet shows up) and no offers to pick up anymore on the backend (variance was not my friend on the floor this trip and lost a night of gambling due to the robbery so my Theo wasn't as high as my previous trip). I only got an extra $150 on the bankend in F&B because I pushed for it to make up for the cash taken from her wallet.

Now I'm relatively new to gaming so I wasn't entirely sure if robbery was just baked in to my invite offer and it was just a tough luck thing on my side. My wife is still traumatized by the event and is extremely skeptical about going to Vegas again. She now wants to get a concealed weapon permit (she was very anti-gun before) because she doesn't feel safe anymore. We were lucky he ran out after seeing she was in the room, she is barely over 100 lbs and had recently had a surgery a couple weeks prior.

I'm a reasonable guy and believe things happen outside of the Palazzo's control, but the response is something they can entirely control and it fell flat on its face. The last straw came for me when I received the backend charges on my Amex for $400. Despite being undercomped the previous trips and being robbed this trip I had to ask to have even the basics of what was taken comp'd.

You'd think they'd bend over backwards to keep a player who reached platinum in 6 weeks over 3 trips so I sent Andy Grisnik (VP of Player Development and Host Operations) a message about my experience on the 23rd of February. I mentioned I'm willing to give the Palazzo a chance to correct the situation and I understand a series of unfortunate events can occur.

I have yet to hear back from him and so now I'm resorted to writing a negative review which I'm loathe to do, but here I am.

Be careful when you stay at the Palazzo, double check to make sure your room door is shut and locked. A poor design of the door causes a deadbolt to slightly come out if you lift the handle some as you open the door. From what I can tell this is what kept the door for closing behind me completely. Be sure to use your safe for any important documents\/cash. And lastly don't expect the Palazzo to take care of you.  Even after a bad review on another site I get nothing but a canned response, so I'll make sure it is everywhere.

My first stay at the Palazzo was a great experience consisting of a mixed bag of things to love and minor hiccups that couldn't be ignored. 

Check-in \/ Bell-service \/ Valet were a breeze on a busier Holiday weekend. The decor and layout of the hotel and casino floor was spacious, never crowded and aesthetically pleasing in many ways with a plethora of bars and restaurants within striking distance between there and the Venetian. A ten minute walk +\/- can get you to the Encore or Paris depending on which way you're aiming for. 

The rooms were very spacious though the best strip view you'll be lucky to come upon would be of TI and Trump Int'l. While the decor of the rooms was nicely appointed and comfortable, we couldn't help ignore the fact that they came without any music connectivity.. No iPod docking station, auxiliary input or music channels on TV which are typically standard at most resorts of this stature and essentials for Vegas-ing the right way. There's also no coffee provided in the rooms so you'll have to either purchase a carafe or run downstairs for a morning jolt. (Tip: take a short walk to the illy Espressamente for an amazing espresso macchiato) Furthermore, we ran into issues with Room Service not showing up after hours of waiting up for them in the late hours. 

The staff all around were very welcoming, friendly and helpful - by far one of the best features. There's only one small pop-up store located near the tower entrance with limited items to purchase; I don't recall it being 24 hours either. 

Overall I would stay here again but only on a really good deal on the Prestige floor. There are other resorts that offer just a bit better of a value for the same price in my opinion **cough cough** wynn **cough cough** encore
This place was EPIC. Large, clean, modern rooms. Casino is well maintained. Always lively and the staff is comprised of extremely polite and helpful individuals. Viva Las Vegas!

This is a review of the casino gambling experience at the Palazzo, which was totally awesome.

First of all, I was delighted to see only $10 minimums for table games (it was during the day, but still).  Of all the high-end places on the strip, the Palazzo seemed not to jack up the minimums too fast or too early.  (Sure, you can go to Circus Circus and play table games with $2-$3 minimums, but If you want to gamble in a nicer place, I strongly recommend the Palazzo.)  

The staff was totally nice and friendly, even the pit bosses.  The drink service at the table games was the BEST I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED, PERIOD.  (The waitresses were totally hot and scandalously dressed, and were tripping over each other to bring me free microbrews.  It was delightful.)

Also, the bartender at the little elevated bar with video poker machines did an awesome job of keeping players well-lubricated, plus was real friendly.

When I won a ton of money at roulette, the croupier seemed genuinely happy for me and was nice.  I'm not a slots player, but I will say the slots at the Palazzo were the most nice and new and hi-tech looking I'd ever encountered.

Well done, Palazzo casino!

I just got back from a weekend stay at the Palazzo.  I've read many mixed reviews but I thought I'd check this place out myself....three words:

ooo la la!  

When you first walk in the registration area is very grandiose.  Beautiful. We checked in around 10 pm on Friday night.  There were just a few people in line so check in was a breeze.    

The two of us stayed in the standard suite with a king bed.  The room was HUGE!  There are a total of 3 flat screen LGs.  This was awesome in itself.  There was one in the bathroom, living room (with DVD player) and bedroom.  

Let's start with the bathroom.  The LG in the bathroom is in an awkward position.  Not easily viewable if you are in the tub.  The bathroom has double sinks, there is a vanity area for my make up and hair gear, separate room for the toilet, glass enclosed shower and double closing doors.

The living room is sunken and very spacious.  It is furnished with a table for 3, a desk equipped with WIFI and printer, and a super comfy sectional velvet sofa.    

The bed was huge and really comfortable.  The room was also equipped with fancy schmancy remote controlled shades.  Opening the curtains from bed is not too shabby!  

There are countless bells and whistles to this room to make a grown man giggle (he did!)  

Unfortunately, there were a MINOR flaws that I noticed (from some ill reviews I had read before I came).  First, the handles on the various night stands, dressers and armoire were broken\/missing.  Not good. Second, there were cigarette burns on the couch cushions.  C'mon guys, keep your friggin butts of the couch.  Third, the elevators made a horrific noise while you were in it (sounds of a struggle going up and down...scary).  And finally, we could not check out via the TV as it was not working.  Boo!

All in all, the hotel was beautiful.  Just the right size.  Not too big, not too small.  There are plenty of table games not to overwhelm you and plenty of slots to give you carpal tunnel.  I even got $30 free slot play and walked away with $70 bucks for free!  Can't beat that.

I  would definitely return given the minor flaws of the hotel.  The mere ease of the location is well worth the stay.

Note:   We were a couple of morons when we left the hotel (tried to beat the traffic).  We drove all the way home and realized that we left our house keys in the room!  I called lost and found around 6pm and got a call at 10pm saying they found our keys and will be happy to fed ex them back to me.  That is awesome customer service.  Thanks Sharon!

Can you say wow?!  It's a fantastic hotel!  We got awesome deal on a  Palazzo Luxury Suite.  It had a king bed, with flat screen tvs, a great view, a huge bathroom and sunken living room (with a sleeper couch).  And the entire floor came smoke-free.  The casino it self was typical, but the staff was friendly and very accommodating.  If you sign up for Club Grazie, you get $15 of bonus gaming credit.  I'm not a real gambler, but it made for a great 3 hours at the penny slots.

They also offer a cheap cab-alternative to the airport.  It was $6 (per person) for a shuttle, which leaves the hotel every 30 minutes on the hour and half hour.  My only complaint is that it's outsourced, so you don't get the same level of customer service as the actually hotel gives.  Our shuttle was about 20 minutes late and when he arrived to pick us up, he ran inside to use the bathroom for about 10 minutes.  We made our flight, but it was still slightly annoying.

We walked in and opened one of our fine bottles of Cab only to have room service knock on our door: "I noticed you ladies requested wine glasses, here are 4.. and here is some milk and dark chocolate for you to pair with your wine" WOOOW. I was in HEAVEN.

I'll keep my review short and sweet. 

If you're in Vegas.. and you're a group of 4..you HAVE to stay here. Get the room with 2 king size beds! You get a 5 star experience for a bargain! Errr.. if you're 5 then there's a fold out bed via the couch but the bathroom is ideal for no more than 4 to get ready comfortably.

Of course, if you're less than 4, you definitely should still go here but you probably will have to pay a bit more per preson. Still worth it ;) ;)

Sunken livingroom, a gazillion flat screen TV's throughout (even in the bathroom)

I loved loved loved this place~! Nice and classy, great restaurants in the hotel, spacious and affordable if you split it with a group.. ahhh I love finding deals like this. And, yes.. I said DEAL. You get your money's worth here and then some! 

Oups, almost forgot to mention the pool here is awesome. NO ANNOYING STRIPPERS.. a nice family and young adult crowd. Not rowdy and clubbish.. and the pina colada's are awesome :)

Quality all the way.

Ok I pretty much stay here everytime I come to vegas... the rooms are fantastic our host pablo is amazing and the overall feel of the place is upbeat and energized. 

ONLY complaint. The CASINO staff is the WORST I've ever seen. The dealers are awful in the pit and the pit bosses are even worse. The lack of customer service is unreal. I love this hotel and if I am taking the risk of gambling I would like to risk it where I stay but with the type of people I dealt with this weekend I am very reluctant. I've worked in the casino bussiness for 5 years or so and I would be firing people if they acted anywhere near what I saw this weekend. I hope this gets attended too as this hotel is one of my favorites in vegas.

We went there to gamble and have some cocktails this last weekend, but we were actually staying at Ceasar's.   We were impressed by the decor, but we witnessed an unbelievably awful interaction between a cocktail waitress and a patron.
2 African American women were gambling at the automatic blackjack machine with us and a cocktail waitress came around and asked my boyfriend and I if we wanted drinks, but did not ask the women next to us. So, one of the women nicely asked the waitress if they could order another drink too...the waitress looked annoyed and said to them...."Are you guys staying at this hotel?" The women said yes and why are they even asking that. The waitress said, "I have to ask." Which is a LIE!! The women were spending money and whether they were staying there or not has not bearing on the woman bringing them a beverage. The woman pulled out her room card to show her that they were in fact staying at the hotel and the waitress said, "don't you have any paperwork to go along with that?"  When they asked what paperwork, the waitress asked where the envelope that the key came in was and the receipt for their room was.
I was so shocked and saddened by this whole interaction.  The waitress did not ask anyone else to prove that they were staying there, and even when these women did show their room card, she acted as if she didn't believe they could actually be staying there.  It was so clear to me that this cocktail waitress did not believe that these two women could possibly be staying at the hotel and she was rude, hostile, and unbelievably inappropriate. I wish I would have said something in the moment, but I was so taken aback by what I just saw. As a law student, I was horrified at the way these women were treated and I hope they complained to the manager of the hotel.
I will never set foot in this place again.

This resort is a solid Vegas landmark. The rooms are larger than average, suite-style rooms. We got a nice price on it. Room was well appointed. Even the "not good view" room had a VERY nice view of a golf course and the planes coming into the airport.

The pool deck was fabulous. Large and plenty of space. While there were plenty of people, it never seemed crowded. Nice and pretty.

You have to walk to the Venetian (close walk, attached, all inside walking) to find cheaper food to eat. But the flipside of that is: all of the restaurants in the Palazzo were higher end and nice!  

Bonus: there is a Walgreens that is basically attached. Awesome for grabbing an ice chest, some booze and some beers.

The casino floor wasn't the craziest or anything. But you could get around, get a slot machine, etc. Cocktail service was merely average, and they probably need to set a couple more cleaning folks per shift.

Every employee was enoucntered was kind. Even the hard-working, busy cleaning staff would say hello to you as you walked by in the hallway. 

This property has nice rooms, acceptable gambling, interesting restaurants, great pools and high-end service. We pretty much never left the Palazzo\/Venetian property all weekend except for one pre-planned dinner. This is a great place. Book with confidence!

Stayed in the Fortuna Suite and this was one of the biggest rooms I've ever stayed in - simply gorgeous and elegant. I decided to go for the Palazzo over the Venetian b\/c I know they're pretty much the exact same rooms, same prices, but Palazzo is newer and newer is (almost) always better :). 

I like the layout of the Palazzo a lot better than the Venetian (esp from the parking garage to check in to the guest elevators - it all flows very nicely unlike the Venetian where you have to bounce around a lot. Not fun). Although the casino is nothing special at all and a bit boring to be honest. It is MUCH easier to navigate though compared to the Venetian and seems a little less "busy" too. I would also say that the Grand Lux Cafe is better at the Palazzo than the Venetian. Also, being a guest of the Palazzo or the Venetian makes no difference in terms of dining and nightlife, so you're considered a "guest" no matter where you are in either place, which is nice. 

I will pick Palazzo over the Venetian from now on. The Venetian being connected makes it easy to go from one place to the other and I just appreciate the new-ness and simplicity more.

This was by far the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in and it didn't cost me a dime.  Service was excellent from check in to check out and everything in between.

I got a standard suite which consisted of a lower living room area with a huge L-shape sofa with a foldaway bed, 2 queen beds in the bedroom area and a large bathroom.  Each space has their own flat screen tv including the bathroom (3 tvs total)  My 30th floor suite was on the opposite side of the Strip but it still had amazing views of the mountains and I could see the airport.  The room also had remote control curtains which was a nice feature.  The beds were comfortable but it usually takes me a couple of days to get accustomed to sleeping in new environments or I would have enjoyed it more.  The bathrooms have a separate shower and tub.  The toilet is also in a separate room.  While the bathroom is huge, there is little privacy as everything is together in one room.

As I said before this was the nicest hotel that I've ever stayed in.  However, this being Vegas, I would only stay here again if I was comped.  After all, how often was I actually in the room.

My wife and I stayed here for our wedding. Seemed like a beautiful place. When we checked in and got to our room, the lock didn't work and we had to wait in the hallway for an hour until they got the room open and wouldn't just get us into a new room. Service at Lavo and Dal Toro restaurants were crappy, better service at fast food joints. At checkout, baggage pickup from our room was a fiasco.  First call I was told 15 minutes. 30 minutes later I called back and was told 15 minutes. Another 30 minutes passed and I made 3rd call and I was told no request was made and the attitude I received was "I couldn't care less" and was told someone would be there in 15 minutes. I lost my cool at that point and ONLY then did I get some type of action from a manager. It took 1 hour and 20 minutes to get the bags picked up causing us to be late to view our wedding pictures. This place, as nice looking as it is, lacks in service and additionally couldn't care less if its customers are pleased. This establishment will never have my business again in any area of the Palazzo

5 start service
*clean
*friendly
*VIP Amenities are awesome
*Lagassie's Sports Bar is the BEST!!! (huge huge huge screens to watch your fav games & eat amazing BAM! food and gamble too! (private rooms available)

Where do I start?! I checked-in and the staff was great. He was very nice and told me I could ask for a complimentary late check out my last day. He said he already set my check out to 12:30, since I was flying out at night. 
I got a room on the 12th floor and the room was great. I changed and went down to gamble. I asked the pit boss for a card and she took my ID. After 3 hours of playing, I decided to get up after losing $300. I left with a few friends and upon arrival at our location I realized I never got my ID back from the pit boss. I had to pay another cab back to my hotel to get my ID. When I got to the hotel, I asked at the table for my ID. I was told they did not have my ID. I went to security of the Palazzo and they sent me to security of the Venetian. Both told me they did not have my ID and sent me back to the table where I was playing. I went back to my table and was told by the pit boss that she had just started so she didn't know anything. I was told to wait and finally a few minutes later I got my ID back with my card to gamble. The pit boss then told me she would see what she could do for me. Of course she was LYING! The next day I asked to check my card and the pit boss put that I had only played for 12 minutes! 
As if that weren't enough. I call to have late check out and am told there is no complimentary check out. You must pay! Starting at $50 until 2pm! RIDICULOUS! Upon arrival I was told this was the best place to stay. I definitely do not agree! You do not get what you pay for. I would not spend my money here again! They tell you how great it is and treat you well when you check-in and then it all goes downhill from there.

Pros: Excellent decor, huge rooms facing the strip with a really comfy couch, beautiful chairs and bench seats, nice dining table, modern touches with a classic elegance, electric drapery on remote, tv's everywhere, cool bar table that lights up, hidden fridge, didn't even know it existed! Large bathroom with nice vanity, great mood lighting throughout, quiet a\/c, check in was excellent, barely a wait, friendly staff and I got an upgrade for free. I could live in this hotel!
Cons: Facing the strip means having to hear the noisy Treasure Island explosions and yelling until midnight, cleaning staff did not pick up tons of bags of sheets and garbage in hallways until late that night, wireless handset phone did not work, only speakerphone and had to wait forever to get someone on the line, could smell smoke in bathroom and hallways, toilet room has no fan, lightbulb above dining table was burnt out, many decorative caps on mirror had fallen off and were not replaced, hot tub has way too much chlorine (I have a really bad skin rash now) and pool does not get enough sun and closes at 6:30pm.

Overall experience was excellent though, the best hotel I have stayed at in Vegas, I will be back, hopefully for a week!!!

The place is SUITE! (pun intended!) I had the two bed suite with the bi-level "lounge". They supply you with 3 TVs, heaven knows why? but i totally enjoyed using all three! AND the remote to the curtains!? (my remote was broken, the drapes had to be closed manually, but i was able to see my friend's drapes close with the remote!) super fun! You get robes too, sweet!
I stayed here because of a 3 day conference for work. I had the whole suite to myself. If I had all the money in the world, I would live here! 
If i came to vacay in LV, i would stay here!

Four stars is because of the food\/meals.
The conference arranged breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
The first night was a 3 course meal: salad, entree, dessert. 
The salad was yum. The dinner was a rendition of a filet mignon that was unpleasant for me to digest. My co-worker beg to differ, it settled just fine and would have eaten my other half. Dessert was good.
Second day was a breakfast, snack, lunch.
Breakfast was mostly dry goods--bread group-- with coffee, tea, milk, and juice. Snack was a variety of cookies and chips to spike a quick energy. Lunch was my most disliked meal of the day, we had "gourmet" chicken pesto sandwiches. The chicken was really dry and the bread was hard to sink your teeth into. You literally had to eat the thing piece for piece with a fork. If you like pickles, peppers, olives and such...then the sides make up for the "sand"wich. 
The last day we were given a buffet breakfast...a notch better because we had pancakes, eggs, and bacon. Also a choice of dry goods--cereal and granola with yogurt and milk. Coffee and tea of course. No juices this time. Snacks were around, constituted of a hearty protein, energy booster buffet\/bar--nuts, cookies, tea, water, energy juice. Lunch was a box lunch...nothing to really praise over since it's a grab-and-go meal. 
Aside from that, the servers and event coordinators were very friendly and attentive, they are definitely trained well. 
The same goes for the entire hotel staff; the front desk definitely follow the rules.  

Grand Lux Cafe! try not to leave vegas without visiting this place. =)
My favorite hotel on the strip.  Big rooms,  comfy beds,  good service. Always clean and by far one of the best places to stay for a special occasion or just a getaway.

The man is not in Las Vegas to gamble, nor to take selfies with grizzled street performers dressed like Elvis Presley. Getting business done is the primary goal and when the day ends, the man needs a quiet place to lay his head. The Palazzo provides exactly that and in spectacular fashion.

The Palazzo "prestige" desk provided the man with a peaceful, calm, and private check-in experience. Hotel staff was highly competent and friendly, and they accommodated the man's request for a late checkout.

Documentaries like "The Walking Dead" have taught the man the value of having a reliable food source and to that end The Palazzo succeeds, providing access to a wealth of high-quality dining establishments. 

Be sure to throw the deadbolt on your hotel door whenever you're in the room. A hotel employee entered the man's room at 10pm for unknown reasons. That was alarming, especially given that the man has no formal combat training and is not particularly fleet of foot.

The man highly recommends this hotel.

I loved everything about our stay here. It was mine and my husband's first time in vegas and we stayed at multiple establishments to get the true feel of the entire strip. The Palazzo was, hands down, my favorite. It is connected to the Venetian, which in itself was stunning and had fabulous restaurants as well. The infamous TAO restaurant is located in the Venetian. We had a suite with a sunken living room (pure luxury) that overlooked a great piece of the strip and the pools. We had an overall outstanding experience from the employees, food and environment, to spacious and clean rooms!
There are multiple pools that are all stunning and clean and the adults only pool was so much fun! The prices are super high in the adult only pool and only certain areas you can sit in without a limit to spend per person.

We visited for 5 days for my birthday. I mentioned this at the front desk and our check in clerk was able to offer us an upgrade for a very modest upcharge.

This was a move to a multi-room suite with a giant bathtub and shower, a completely seperate living area - really the works!

We independently looked up the rate and found it would have been more than $650 a night. Suffice to say we didn't pay anything NEAR that. Obviously this is subject to availability, but we were very happy with our stay!
A very elegant and beautiful place!  Pricey, of course, but even if you're not staying here and just being a tourist you can appreciate it: stop by, play a little, and take in the surroundings.

Got a nice upgrade to my room because of a reservation mix-up!  Well worth the few extra minutes it took to check in.  

Beautiful room, very comfortable bed and very clean.  Unfortunately the few sucked!  My room actually looked at a giant air-conditioner!  (5th Floor - corner room) No sky line, no strip not even a view of another hotel.  Not a big deal because I didn't spent much time in my room, but it would have been nice to wake up to a view or to see the city lights at night.

One other complaint..  and this goes for all hotels that do this.  Why do you charge Resort Fees?  The cost of the room should include the use of the the hotels amenities!  It's not like you can chose not to use the resort!

Here's the great news... Parking is free!  

The rooms are very quite, we were on a floor with a lot of party rooms on a Saturday Night.  Even though there was noise in the hall, once the door was closed they never bothered me at all.  The pools are decent, except it is mostly shade in the early hours.   

Lots of places to eat, gamble and shop.

I have stayed at The Palazzo at least five times, but I've been coming to Las Vegas for over 20 years. I grew up going to Vegas, and have stayed in almost all of the casinos. I liked the Palazzo because it's quieter than some of the other casinos, and love the way they decorate their rooms. For my 30th this passed weekend I decided to book the Fortuna suite, because I wanted an extra special experience. Unfortunately the room is very falsely advertised. It looks nothing like the images on the website. It's actually worse than their regular rooms. It's about the same size except more awkwardly designed with an extra set of chairs and small table. The front desk manager is probably the worst front desk person I've ever come across. He has a terrible attitude, very unprofessional and not at all worried about providing good customer service. It's very understandable if you cannot accommodate a customer's request, but it's another thing to be rude, argumentative and dismissive. Because of his attitude alone, and what he explained as their "policies" I'll never stay there again. In addition to the poor service, and false advertising, the sheets and bedding feel like paper and are very uncomfortable. With so much competition on the strip and affordable rooms, spend your money somewhere else.

Aesthetically pleasing to the eyes (far from gaudy), conveniently located on the strip, and amazingly accommodating to guests. My friends and I stayed here this past weekend (Aug 2-4), and we couldn't have been more pleased with our experience.

LAGO TWO BEDROOM SUITE --

Provides the comfort of home away from home boasting 1900+ sq ft of room. Two bedrooms: one Master with a king sized bed, and a second bedroom with two queen sized beds (+ pull out bed in the living room). Each room including the living room and bathrooms had its own flat screen. Both bathrooms had their own toilet room and jetted tubs with a separate shower along with double sink vanities. If you arrive a little later in the night like we did, you can draw the curtains apart with remotes to watch the sunrise after checking in which happened to be the most beautiful thing to my sore eyes.

Let me just say that aside from all the above mentioned luxuries, we were blown away by the mere size of the suite upon entrance. If you're traveling with a group of friends\/family (less than 7), it makes the stay so much more comfortable when no one needs to sacrifice a night on the floor.

Another huge plus to the Palazzo was that it was no where near as confusing as I thought it would be to navigate through its casino. Check in was quick, and when we requested several more key cards, we were given no hassle.

When visiting a hotel, I don't expect too much.

Order a non-smoking - get a non-smoking
Room check-in at 3pm - enter room at least by 5pm
Room key provided - should work
Call front desk to fix key - hold and hang up???
Clocks should be set

The room looks great once you get in but it's going to take work and you might just miss your dinner reservation...

Finally got dinner at the Aquinox.  Excellent food, onsite, great service.  The room was a welcome site afterward and my room key worked.  Hopefully the experience is improving.

A girls weekend birthday bash. Where to go? Why, Vegas of course! The next decision? Where to stay!
I went online and researched several hotel options finally settling on a "suite" package at The Palazzo. With the package were were allotted a room credit for use with the mini bar or movies, discounts at certain restaurants & stores, and 2 for 1 drink certificates for some of the hotel bars. 
I was met at the hotel by my best friend, who had flown in from Chicago for our celebratory weekend. We checked in at noon (bonus that our room was ready before normal check-in hours) and were ushered 21 floors up to our suite - it did not disappoint. The bathroom was luxurious and spacious enough for 3 ladies to share for 3 days. (another friend flew in from Philly later that evening) The beds and linens were plush and comfortable. The sunken sitting area\/living room was great extra space to spread out and enjoy cocktails. And the view was amazing! We looked onto the pool as well as the strip with views of Trump Tower, Treasure Island and Fashion Show. 
Within The Palazzo you'll find plenty to do. From restaurants (Dos Caminos, Tao and Sushi Samba) to bars\/nightclubs (Lavo, Tao Nightclub, V Bar, Laguna Champagne Bar) the casino, and the Shoppes at the Palazzo there is plenty to entertain you and you literally don't even have to leave the hotel. Even nicer, is the fact you can access The Venetian as well as Encore and Wynn quite easily since they are all linked by pedestrian bridges. 
For a girls weekend, birthday or any other event where Vegas calls, I would highly recommend checking out The Palazzo. Even better if you can score a deal during off season, like I did. Waking up in a comfortable, luxurious room, is well worth the hangover you're likely to incur during your visit! Viva Las Vegas!

My new favorite hotel in Vegas! This past weekend I stayed at the Mirage on Friday and didn't have a plan for Saturday night.
So that morning I went on hotels tonight to see what hotel was the most inexpensive.
For some unknown reason the Palazzo and the Venetian were both $210 ($250 with taxes and fees), which is cheaper than almost every other hotel on the strip. I was both confused and excited by this finding. 

So my boyfriend and I drive over to the hotel at about 11am, crossing our fingers we can check in early. The line at the desk moved quickly and he man at the counter was so pleasant and helpful. He got us a room with two queen beds on a non smoking floor no problem. 

My first reaction when walking into the room was "this can't be right." The rooms have SO MUCH SPACE and SO MUCH CLASS. Everything about it was beautiful and inviting. The room comfortably slept six people. 

We had to call for extra pillows and blankets and they were delivered to our room within 6 minutes, and we were on the 40th floor. I'm still confused about how they pulled that off. 

The pool could be my favorite part. They let you bring alcohol in! Unlike so many other pools in Vegas. We got down to the pool around 3pm and had no problem finding chairs (which are the nice cushioned lounges btw) for everyone in our group. The beer at the pool was $7.50\/bottle which is significantly less than the $11\/bottle beer at the Mirage pool (also the chairs and service there were terrible).

There is also a Walgreens in the hotel which is soooo convenient. I really can't imagine staying anywhere else in Vegas! I'm hooked for life.

The room is huge, the inside is pretty and the people
Bad internet and AC

Not super centrally located on the strip either so getting to the other casinos can be a bit of a pain...but i guess that's their goal ;)

To be honest I was originally hoping to book my stay at the Wynn, but the Palazzo had a great price, and I couldn't say no. I completely lucked out and it beat all my expectations.
Everything about my stay in their luxury suite was amazing, and I can't wait to come back. Their front desk employee, Joshua was extremely nice and accommodating. He gave us a room on the 49th floor of the Palazzo, note there are 50 floors in the Palazzo and the 50th floor is penthouses. The view from the 49th was incredible.

Our room was a standard king bed suite. However, there was nothing standard about the suite. It was huge! The bathroom was giant and featured a separate tub and stone shower. There was also a separate living room area with a sectional couch with pullout bed. Everything thing about the room was modern without being cold. It was very inviting. The sheets were a bit rough, but the bed itself was very comfortable.

We stayed at the Palazzo this past weekend and had a great experience.  We have not stayed at the Venetian or the Wynn before, so I am not sure how it compares to them.  We booked the Palazzo through Priceline and only paid $140 per night when rooms were retailing on the Palazzo's website for $350 per night.

Check-in was incredibly smooth...we checked in a little after 3 and it took less than 10 minutes from the time we parked the car until we had a room key.  The room was incredibly spacious....the only negative was our view. We were on the back and had a rather unpleasant view of alleyways and service entrances for the different surrounding businesses and hotels.  Checkout went very smoothly as well, and the morning we were leaving, we arranged for late checkout which was not a problem at all.

The casino at the Palazzo is small and pretty basic, so it wouldn't warrant a stop unless you were staying there.  It's nice that it is connected to the Venetian, and there is elevator access to the Canal Shops and the Canyon Ranch spa.  My huge negative about the Palazzo is it was impossible to get a taxi on Saturday night a little before 6 pm.  In fact, we had to get a towncar because the taxi line moved incredibly slow and I think for 10 minutes, I did not see one cab pull up.  We had to spend more money than we wanted for towncar service, but it was necessary to make sure we weren't super late to dinner.  I would recommend that if you need a taxi, just walk over to the Venetian because your luck will probably be better there.

UPDATE (6\/3\/08):
I was in Vegas this past weekend with some girlfriends and we booked the Palazzo via Priceline for $207\/night.  Again, a very nice experience especially as we were able to get early check-in.  Upon arriving, we decided to check out the pool. Blah. Bad idea. It took us almost 45 minutes to finally get a cocktail waitress to come over despite asking five different employees to send one over. I understand it's a big area, but we never even saw a waitress walk around until she finally came over. Once we got her over to us once, she was good about checking on us continually.  There is a little cafe outside of the pool area where you can order food to go, but I did not find the menu very impressive at all. I think if you have a cabana, you must have a different menu (I think the same one as Tao Beach).  Personally I would skip the Palazzo pool and just head over to the Venetian for Tao Beach.
Best hotel in Vegas! Staff is great, sunken living room and not super crowded. Highly recommend.

One of the most beautiful hotels not only in Vegas, but in the world! Also, did you know that the Palazzo is the 6th largest building in the world in terms of available ground space? My feet definitely felt it..

I love the sunken living room and the gorgeous, large bathroom. Everything feels so luxurious and you definitely get what you pay for. I've never shopped in the "Shoppes" because I can't afford it, but its fun to window shop :) The casino floor is spacious, and the restaurants and entertainment the hotel has to offer are top notch.

Stayed here 2 nights with four other guys for a bachelor's party. The suite had 2 double beds (w\/ posturepedic bed, comforters, soft pillows) and a L shaped couch with pull out bed. 3 flat screen TVs in the suite: 1 for the 2 double beds, 1 for the couch, and 1 in the room-sized bathroom with full bath and shower. Very nice interior design. The location is great too, across the street from Wynn, Treasure Island, and the Fashion Mall which are all connected by sky bridges. On the 3rd floor is their Canyon Spa Resort which has full features including hot tub, steam rooms, saunas, massages, etc. Many high end restaurants in the hotel.

I had to get away recently and Vegas was more than appropriate.  The Palazzo was a great place to stay.  The pros: the price! We were in a suite that was just fantastic with three TVs, a living room type area, and a bathroom that made me just want to stay there for a day and forget the strip!  I watched the morning news while taking a shower.  Only in Vegas.  The hotel was beautiful, but certainly not the most impressive.  The con really was that it took forever to check-in and it took over an hour to get shampoo after they forgot to give us two days in a row.   I'll definitely stay again for the price alone!

Beautiful room.  Nice to relax and not feel like you are in a hotel room.  Huge tub for soaking after a long day of walking.  The food court was convenient if nothing else, food not the best quality.  I felt as though I was eating high end cafeteria food.  Stick to the many other options when choosing your meal.  Staff was wonderful and very helpful when asking for directions or local information.  I wish I had been able to find a few extra moments to enjoy the pool, it looked very inviting.  Next time for sure.

I WALKED INTO THE LOBBY AND FELT LIKE JULIA ROBERTS IN PRETTY WOMAN...

Bottom line...I LOVE THIS PLACE!  
It's a great spot when you have a bunch of people and you can save so much money on a suite!  The suites are HUGE and waaaaay nice!  You have three plasma tv with one of them being in the bathroom!  You really feel like a BALLA in this room!

Plus, it's connected to the Venetian so you can enjoy all of the perks of the Venetian as well!  From this point on, every group Vegas trip I take, I will for sure be staying atthe Palazzo!

Beautiful hotel right by the adjoining the Venetian.  3.5 stars. 

There are varying food\/resto options which makes gives it a good mark in my book.  

We situated ourselves in a relatively grande suite. The main living area is spacious and is large enough to sleep a huge party of girls. The comfy couches serve as beds while the staff offers rollaways just in case your girls aren't intoxicated enough to knock out on the floor. 

We even had a lil gym room that sported an elliptical machine. It served itself as a glorified towel rack. 

At one point, we had three blowdryers going which in turn ended up shorting the circuits, rendering all our hair gadgets  useless. Sigh. Luckily, the other room which was attached to our suite had functioning outlets. 

Anyway, the room deco struck me odd. I'm not quite sure how to explain it, but it didn't hold as much of a modern value as I would have liked. I did, however, really love the bathroom. It may have been the best part of the suite

Fyi, our first night, we were in the bella suite, which was smaller, but still boasted enough space to hold 9 people. 

Our second\/third night, we had moved to a two bed room suite.

I want to publicly express my disappointment with the palazzo staff during my most recent stay. My family and I were escaping hurricane Irma (we live in southeast Florida) and trusted that the palazzo would take care of us. I was traveling with my wife, 3 year old and two month old. Our flight to Vegas was cancelled, resulting in us missing the first night of our stay. The palazzo could not have cared less and refused to refund us for the night in spite of us calling ahead to let them know we weren't going to make it so they could reallocate the room. I called Expedia (through whom we booked the package) and they were also told by the palazzo that we were out of luck. Expedia felt so bad for us that they gave us a $50 credit out of their pocket as an apology for the palazzo's unwillingness to help us. American airlines handled the flight situation with class, rebooking us on a flight first thing the next morning with no questions asked. Then, to compound things, our jet blue flight home was cancelled on Tuesday and the palazzo was unable (or unwilling) to accommodate us for the three extra nights we needed to stay in Vegas. Again, the airline took care of us by getting us rebooked on the next available flight. I recognize that the palazzo did not "have" to do anything but it sure would have been nice if they had given us a break. With all of the options of places to stay in Vegas I can assure you that the palazzo is no longer on that list.

I've stayed at this hotel more than once. And I have to say it's been a favorite of mine. Great rooms. Great service and most of all great location. The rooms are modern looking with great views. If you are an American Express Black card holder you get a whole separate section to check in as well as great upgrades for your room. You cannot go wrong with this hotel and you will not be disappointed with your stay. The restaurants and the spa were also a great addition to have at this hotel.

By far, hands down this is THE BEST hotel I've stayed in out of ALL my trips to Vegas. I've been at The Palms, Luxor, MGM, Venetian & PH(2x). The rooms are nice & spacious, customer service is good & best of all, if you a woman especially,  the lighting in the bathroom is great! The rooms are dark & gloomy.

I've stayed nearly everywhere on the strip. Palazzo seeminlgly has nice rooms and the staff was very professional.But there is something missing,perhaps its the illusion of luxury. It might be the ultra thin walls or the fact that I did not expect to see as much riff raff at this location. I suppose it's everywhere ,but,didn't expect to see as much.

  I don't know why hotels,especially luxury ones, do not have better sound proofing. I don't need to hear adjacent doors constantly opening\/closing and losers running around the hallway with drink cups for hours. 

  Overall it is ok,if you can get a deal on the room it's fine,but don't pay top dollar. Do not eat at Table 10.

I love love love love the Venetian and decided to try the Palazzo since the rooms are slightly cheaper., the same square footage, and essentially the same place.  A few observations about the Palazzo that made me kind of regret my choice:

1. The elevators took FOREVER to arrive, whether we were on the first floor or the seventh.
2. Room service took forever.

However, in the Palazzo's defense, we placed our order right before we started getting ready to go out.  I wanted some finger food on the coffee table so we could munch while we were preparing for a big night of debauchery.  They told me it would take 1.5 hours for a $210 order.  I asked them to expedite it please.  They brought it up a half hour later.  Perfect timing, the first person had just finished in the shower.

As for the elevators, a very knowledgeable valet asked me how my stay compared to the my stays at the Venetian.  I hesitated, and he jumped on that.  Tell me, he probed.  So I told him how annoying the elevators were, how they took FOREVER, and how, on Sunday morning at 10:45am, right before checkout, getting an elevator to the 7th floor that we or even one of us could fit into, was impossible, so we climbed the 7 flights of stairs down.  I understand it was right before check-out on a Sunday morning, but I never encountered such an annoyance staying in the Venetian. 

And let's just say that the hotel probably hadn't anticipated on guests' eyes being laid on the stairs-- dirty, no signs, kind of creepy, etc.  Even a room service guy when we poked our head in on the 4th floor offered the freight elevator for our usage, but of course, we thought, hey, it's been 3 flights; now we're on an adventure! 

The valet informed me that they were trying a new "program," to which I responded that they should stick with the Venetian's elevator system, because it's fast with no remarkable problems that I could recall.  He said the Venetian was trying the same program on their elevators.  I wonder how that's working out.  

Parking is also a little weird, but it's our own fault.  We didn't know where the Palazzo self-parking was, so we parked in the Venetian self-parking which is a hike.  Then, when it was time to request bell service to get our luggage down, he brought it out to the Palazzo drive, so my friend had to go get his car from the Venetian, drive it around the entire place, and somehow end up in the Palazzo portico.  A fiasco, but not at the fault of the Palazzo.

What I would change?  Faster room service (or maybe just note of recommendation as to when they are busiest) and faster elevators!

This all being said, I'm staying at the Palazzo again in 2 weeks.  Parking's been solved, room service expedited works, and if the Venetian is having the same problem with their elevators, I'll save myself the extra $20 to put toward a bar tab.
My favorite place to stay in Vegas! It's a bit less busy than Venetian, but just as good. I love the shopping, restaurants, and especially the spa. No complaints.

The hotel is great even if Smell in the casino area is quite bad with all the smoking ..... But we loved rhos Hotel especially for Carol the lady at the Concierge...she was amazing to support us on all activities we had plan to do.

Awesome hotel. I haven't been to Vegas in 15 yrs. Had no idea where to stay as the last hotel we stayed at has been blown up already. Friend recommended the Palazzo. It's by far the best on the strip for the price. All the rooms are large suites. I got the cheapest room was thought a view and the room is I believe 720
Sq ft. Much larger then most of the upgraded rooms at different hotels. There is so much to do and different restaurants that you never have to leave. If you do want to leave, you are really get in the middle of everything. With the Vegas heat, I didn't want to walk far. Everything is within walking distance even in the heat. Highly Recommended.

I have been to Vegas a million of times and have experienced a number of different hotels.  However, this last trip, I took my entire family (3 kids- 9,8,4y\/o) and wanted to find the right hotel\/casino.  After this trip, my conclusion is that the Palazzo is the perfect hotel for families.  
Hotel:  This is one of the newer hotel being only 7-8 years old. It doesn't look run down and still has the new hotel vibe working.  The place is clean and bright.  It is located in an ideal location, connected to Venetian, across the street (short walk) to Mirage and Wynn, and the Fashion Mall.  The Casino is on the smaller size but makes for a shorter walk.  I love the fact that from valet, you are in your room in about 5 mins. I love that there is only 1 set of elevators to take you to your room.  I never waited longer than 15 seconds for an elevator.  Lots of restaurants to choose from too.
Rooms:  Very nice and spacious.  If you get the Bella room (2 queen beds) you will have plenty of space for your family.  There are plenty of lighting in the room.  I like that the blinds are controlled by a remote control.  The only thing is that you cannot utilize the fridge in the room due to the mini bar being controlled by sensors.  The bathroom is large.  I just wished there were more outlets and plugs for the new lightening charger. Our room was 10-818 and a short walk to the elevators. Wifi was included in the resort fee ($28) and was pretty decent.  Speed was good but you would loose connection once you went to the lobby.
Service:  Overall very good.  We utilized housekeeping a few times and they responded quite fast.  Bellman were very friendly and also responded pretty fast.  The only thing that was a tad slow was valet.  They wouldn't let you call down to have your car brought out front (they would put it on the "priority" list).  So we would wait up to 15 mins for our car.  
Amenities:  They seem to have a very nice pool area even though we did not utilize it.  Ample shops and restaurants to eat at.  No kids arcade or hang out though.  Great shows.  My biggest compliment is their workout facility.  Lots of equipment and free weights.  Even yoga and other fitness classes to choose from.  Only negative is that it closers at 8pm.  
Value:  IT was great cuz my rooms were comped.  

All in all, a great hotel for family.  I would definitely return.

This is where you will find the "best spa in the world," - or at least one I've been to and I love a great spa experience, especially while in Vegas.  It is indeed one of the best hotels to stay at, great location.  I have stayed at the Venetian also, both are great, but this one, to me, is a tad better.

From the moment you walk in the door - just superb. I was greeted by a very friendly and helpful staff as soon as I exited the taxi. The check-in team was great! I was there a bit early and was given the option to take a different room (if I wanted) or I could wait for the room I booked (a King suite) which was not a problem. I was given the key and instructions that I would receive a phone call with my room number as soon as it was ready and the key would be programmed so I wouldn't have to come back to the front desk. How awesome is that!?

Within 30 minutes, I got a call, as promised. The room was phenomenal! It was spotless and I even got lucky with a room on the Strip-side...BONUS! The bed was so comfortable and the bedding was high quality. 3 televisions in the room (which is a bit excessive but neat). The sunken living room and electronic shades were cool. The bathroom was gorgeous and the complementary toiletries were excellent. I really am just so impressed with the Palazzo.

One item I'd like to make note of is the concierge. I rarely use concierge services but as we were in Vegas for business (a convention) we were happy to use their services. My boss used them to book reservations for dinners with clients and they were even able to get a table for us an hour before we were expected to be at a lunch meeting - oops for procrastination but they saved the day! They printed my boarding pass on my day of departure and were so knowledgeable and friendly. I would absolutely stay here again. I enjoyed my entire stay, top to bottom and everything in between.

The Palazzo is probably one of the nicer hotels on the strip. The hotel itself boasts great architecture, a small but nice casino, cool artwork and a wonderful selection of restaurants. The Palazzo is much nicer than its sister location The Venetian, but is connected to The Venetian giving all hotel guest access to all of its offerings and amenities. The rooms at The Palazzo are much larger than most other hotels on the strip and are very well appointed and decorated. Having stayed here a couple of times, the Siena Suite is my preference at this hotel, it's spacious, gorgeous, boasts great views, has a nice jacuzzi tub, a huge bathroom and a fantastic shower. Overall, I come to Vegas quite often and if the comps or certain rooms aren't available at the Cosmo or Wynn, the Palazzo will be my go to. This place is great. 

Pros-
Spacious rooms 
Location
Restaurants 
Valet 
Connected to Venetian 
Showers 
Suites
Grazie players club 
Ease of booking 
Proximity to convention center
Casino games 
Amenities 
Photo opportunities 

Cons-
Service 
Internet service is slow 
Feels like and upsell when checking in

Great rooms, easy access in and out this place really did a terrific job.  I had the choice between here and Encore and don't regret it one bit.    Only subtracted a star because they charged me $50 to do a late checkout.

The Palazzo is almost like my second home.  No not really but if I were to have a place in the strip this would be the place! 

The hotel is beautiful and their service is excellent, it's a palacial setup with extraordinary decor, it's very comfortable and inviting.  It's not an uber large hotel\/casino with plenty of free space and less crowds.   

The location makes this place a great destination for it's located near the casinos and shows we like to visit.  

They have some excellent restaurants and shops between the Palazzo and the Venetian.   We like how the two are tied together.  We've stayed at the Venetian but prefer the rooms and service at the Palazzo.    

The service is amazing.  They are very accommodating and they will find a way to make your trip even more enjoyable.   

This is a fabulous hotel and casino.  They are well worth the money and if you gamble to May even get a night comped.   I'm looking forward to see you at the tables here in the Palazzo!

I live in Henderson--just a few minutes away from the strip. Being a local, I barely visit the strip. I made the exception for my 21st birthday. I stayed at The Palazzo and when I walked in, I was met with elegance and beauty. The lobby was just spectacular and they had entertainers dressed up in bright costumes that was reminiscent of Carinvale in Venice. I mentioned that I was staying for my birthday and the front desk lady offered me a free upgrade to a view. I was in awe of what she did for me. We stayed on the 46th floor and that was the highest I have ever been inside of a hotel. I had a view of the Wynn golf course and the entire valley. I will stay here again, if I am ever on the strip. The suite was spacious, clean and beautiful. I loved the bathroom. I was okay with giving up the sunken living room for that view. All in all, I loved my stay here at the Venetian.

I stayed here for the first time a week ago for my girlfriends bachelorette weekend.  Normally we stay at the the Venetian but this time we decided on the Palazzo.  The rooms have a bit more modern finish than the Venetian rooms, but the layout is identical.  The rooms are spacious and sleeps up to 6.  

We did have problems with the room keys being demagnitized on several occasions.
I booked an uber from here and they made the driver pick me up in an underground parking garage.  I guess the taxi mafia is paying this hotel for pick ups.  Gross hotel.  Will not come back.

If it wasn't for the nice rooms, I think it would've had two stars instead.  I stayed there for two nights, and it started off horrible.  We went through the Club members line and it takes forever.  I think the regular line was going faster than us.  The desk wasn't too friendly and it was rather obvious they didn't like to be there.  We had to wait about 2 hours for our room, and then when we finally got our room, it took them 30 minutes to delivered the wrong luggage. Then another hour to find the right one to get to us. I was tired from my almost 6 hour flight.  Needless to say, I was unhappy with the overall service.  No one really smiles or seems happy to be there.  At least pretend!

The room is nice though because its really new.  But at a place like this, I expected much better in service.  

What I do recommend is that everyone get a Club card from Venetian because they do give a lot of promotions compared to other hotels.  I much preferred the Wynn and Bellagio and even the Palm Place over the Palazzo.  For some reason, I just never really got attached to the Venetian or the Palazzo.  There's no spark, no pleasant suprises, it's just a nice hotel with regular service, nothing memorable, and that's pretty bad, because everything in Vegas should be memorable to those who visit, and they don't go above and beyond to make it that way.

We stayed two nights at the Palazzo. I haven't stayed anywhere but the Wynn for years so I was a bit nervous about the quality and size of the room, however the Palazzo did not disappoint. 

We were comp'ed rooms from when we had played on a previous trip. From check in to baggage service we had all the same experience as the Wynn, if not better. We had a standard room, which they refer to as a suite. The room was much larger than the rooms at the Wynn. I would give them a 10 on size, compared to the Wynn at a 7. In terms of quality the Wynn still prevails (9) but Palazzo (8) is close. 

The bed, which is very important to me, was high quality and met the Wynn head on. I couldn't tell the difference between the two. 

The location is great. Between the shopping at the Wynn, Palazzo and Venetian you have everything you want. On top of that their are many top notch restaurants within walking distance. One of my favorites is still Alex at the Wynn. 

One con for me was I found the Palazzo and Venetian more crowded than the Wynn which at times was annoying. 

Most importantly, would I stay again, even if I had to pay - YES!

The hotel is nice and clean but the staff at the front desk was very rude and misleading. Told us twice on the phone when we booked that we would be guaranteed an early check in at 11when we called ahead to tell them we were arriving by 11 they told us we would not be able to check in until anywhere between the hours of 3 to 12PM. Because it was a holiday weekend and they were booked full. They did see in our notes though that we were guaranteed an early check in. However, if I knew this was a holiday weekend why did they not know it was a holiday weekend? When we complained to the staff at the check-in desk they were all very rude including the manager that I asked to speak to. When we arrived they checked us in and guaranteed us our room would be ready within an hour  and was already being cleaned by housekeeping , which was already an hour past the time that we were guaranteed to be checked in.  We agreed to wait went and had a bite to eat. After two hours we went back to the front desk they told us they had not even began to clean our room.  We  needed to get in our room to clean up and change to be at a conference that afternoon . When I tried to cancel my room to go to a different hotel ( that we usually stay at) that could've taken us they suddenly had my room available.
However, the bellhop the valet and housekeeping were all very polite and friendly. The restaurants that we did eat in at the hotel we're all very good.

Wow! That is really the best way to describe this hotel.  

The rooms were unbelievable. They were so freaking big considering that they were just the standard room.  Definitely closer to the size of a suite. Even the bathrooms were unbelievable.

The conference rooms were also so freaking gorgeous.  All ginormous too. Very classy.

Really just had a fantastic experience - I highly recommend.

The dealers manning the roulette tables get icky and weird when someone is winning consistently. They act rude and create an atmosphere of animosity. Aria in comparison was real good, had fun at Aria. Avoid Pallazo for casino.

We have now stayed at the Palazzo two different times and for a week each stay and we enjoy it very much! We usually like to try other hotels each time we go to Vegas which is usually a few times a year, and we really enjoy the Palazzo!
We ordered room service  and the food was good and the service was so nice and above the regular room service!
The hotel is clean and very nice!
My son loves the tv in the bathroom!

When my mom checked in to the Venetian, they told her we were in the Palazzo and they didn't have any rooms left in the actual Venetian hotel (Palazzo is part of the Venetian) but that was just fine with us because the suites were amazing! We had great city and mountain views, big bedrooms, a large sunken living room with a couch, office area, and the bathrooms were awesome as well (with TV's!). We had a great time and loved this location. I'd definitely recommend it!

Ok so I'm giving it three stars because a hotel should be about the total experience.  I will say I do agree the other Yelp reviews.  The rooms are awesome and the property is impressive BUT I have to say the clientele is RATCHET.   I would not suggest going during peek weekends or times.  If you are going to stay in your room then I'd give the place 5 stars...

This is a very nice hotel. Clean and modern. Really enjoyed me stay. Unfortunately, I left a necklace in the room and called the hotel FIVE minutes later to report it. I told the housekeeping manager exactly where in the room it was and told them that since it was still not technically check out time, I would come back immediately to retrieve it. She said she would talk to the housecleaning staff and call me back before 3pm. They said they never found it. Since I only bought the necklace the day BEFORE, I was pretty outraged. I spoke with the hotel manager and explained what happened. She apologized profusely for it and told me to bring my receipt for it and she would compensate for the necklace so I could re-purchase. WOW! That was amazing! I was completely blown away by that. She could not have been nicer nor more helpful. I was expecting a huge blow out in the check in area and was so pleased she wanted to HELP instead of blow me off! The room was beautiful, with a sunken living room and we were on the side where we could see the TI pirate show (not like it's worth seeing). There are some other hotels I'd like to stay at first before I come back here, but I will definitely DEFINITELY come back. I will not forget how management took care of me!
Thank you Palazzo!

We were guests again the middle week of June, 2012.  I thought it impossible, but service was actually better than the excellent service last time.

The room was a dream.  Gorgeous wants me to tear out the two bathrooms at home and have two delivered from the Palazzo.  The sunken living room was a delight and the tech stuff next to the desk was up to date.  I conducted just enough business to make me want to stop.  So I did.

We upgraded to a Hospitality package and it was worth every penny.  A charming continental breakfast each morning.   Whore D'erves (it prounces right, I just can't spell it right) each evening.  The staff was professional and charming.  The Hospitality Room on the Concierge Floor was filled with big chairs, big couches, plenty of tables.  We sat back and enjoyed the view of the Strip.  Lights coming on in recognition of a setting sun.

Staff throughout the Palazzo and the Venetian were courteous and responsive to our every need and question.

Yes, we'll go back.  I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Vegas.

Staff . . . you were out of this world!!

Norm and Pam

Great up-scale hotel on the Strip.  Was able to score a pretty decent price of 138 bucks a night via priceline.  

Like sister hotel the Venetian, all rooms are suites and huge.  The bathrooms are great, and even has a TV so you can be entertained while getting ready to go out.

This is ALL-TIME fav Vegas stomping ground. Its suites are rightly sized and the people at the tables are nice. You won't find the rambunctious party kids here. I feel more comfortable sitting at the tables knowing that the person next to me isn't about to fall over from drunkenness. Not that there's anything wrong with that but I feel safer for my person.

It's a hotel with GREAT shops. It's a hotel with terrific restaurants. It's a hotel with a nice ambience that doesn't encourage rank smells. It's a hotel with a pretty hotel. And if you want something more mass market, just scoot on over to the sister hotel The Venetian. 

If I need to point out anything, it's a hotel that doesn't have a poker room. But no worries, the Venetian has covered off on that. 

Shopping includes Van Cleef & Arpels (see my other review), Barneys New York, Christian Louboutin, some other nice nice stuff. 

Definitely recommended for your vacation.

BEFORE you visit vegas make sure u SLUTS get your
*nails done- pick a bright color for your toes 
*baylage hair highlights- to match your tan
*make sure you pre tan so you dont burn by the pool!!
*eyelash extensions ! every bitch has them- u gotta keep up
*Brazilian bikini w\/ a strip ( in honor of the strip tee-hee)
Also: shave your toe hair pls!!!

WHAT to BRING
*plenty of ducolax LAXatives- even if you dont get constipated you need to take 1 or 2 before bed so you look skinny the next day. Drinking+buffet= lookin 3 months preggo
*Pumis bar for yalls ratchet feet. They will be nasty AF!
*FLATS - I have some swarovski rene caovilla, shits expensive but this is a necessity so you dont end up being mistaken for a hooker because your wasted and barefoot on the strip.
* Everything in your closet so that you dont forget anything. 


Being from Orange County, Vegas is just a 4 hour drive so I have the opportunity to visit frequently. For this reason I consider myself a Vegas PRO ( This time, we chose to spend 3 nights at the lovely Palazzo, the little bitch sister of the Venetian, in the beginning of June, the off season.The crowds at night roam the hotels like cattle roaming dumbfounded through a farm. I like to avoid these people as much as possible!!! Thats why I like staying at the lil bitch sister resorts (palazzo, aria towers, encore, ect) this side of the strip in general is way less crowded in general regardless of where u stay.

I chose to venture off one night and roam the strip like common folk'. I wanted to make it to the Bellagio to see the underwater flower theme, but the furthest I made it was treasure island. I  decided to turn around after the cluster fuck of people gave me a panic attack. I think I would have needed a roofie to prepare me for the shit show of ghetto @$$ people.  The crowd roamed shoulder to shoulder aimlessly like walkers from the walking dead.After the clubs let out, the  walkers followed the large mob of people we were all in. These walkers were looking for late night munchies and trouble. girl walkers had no shoes, hair fucked up, their mascara was smudged. Some sluts had been crying from picking fights  while prowling guys swooped in on them for a horny midnight meal. guy walkers were convinced the louder they yelled the longer their dicks grew.

Over all I decided to turn around and head baack to my luxurious haven- The Palazzo.It was nice to feel like  a queen and return to the sanctuary of my room- I wonder if those poppers ever made it back to their quarters? Or what about the barefoot girls? eeeeeeehhuuuuewww

Very nice hotel.
Clean upgraded LARGE rooms!
Enjoying a nice weekend  here.
I would recommend it.
Only one small problem - Left on Saturday mid day for 4 hours and came back but room had not been made up.

Have now stayed at the beautiful Palazzo twice (May 2015 and then loved it so much again in August 2015).  I have stayed at nine other Vegas properties (including Bellagio, Delano\/Mandalay Bay, and many others) and Palazzo is the cream of the crop.

I have always had success checking in before 3PM (which is great after a five hour flight) and always treated like royalty by the site staff.  Everything from the casino floor to the dining options to the pool and finally the beautiful and LARGE room make the Palazzo my absolute favorite Vegas property.  

Starting with the location on the strip, it is in one of the most prime locations.  Next to the Wynn, across from Mirage and Caesars, and connected to the Venetian for many options to dine and play.  Often, you can find very reasonable rates to stay and since every room is a suite with a full living area + bedroom, I think you get more bang for your buck than many of the other "premium" resorts on the strip.

Onto the room... what a room.  Great views of the strip, large space if you are spending time in the room, his and hers sinks in the bathroom, and very clean and well maintained.  The bed is absolutely comfortable and when you are going back for a nap after a long day walking or drinking at the pool, it is just what the doctor ordered.  The sheets are very comfortable and ditto the bath towels. The view of the Mirage and Venetian are great, especially at night.

The casino itself has a lot of variety and although you feel like can get lost there, after a day you start to know your way around.  One great thing is it shares an indoor walkway to the Venetian, so more variety is a five minute walk away.  The casino bars are nice and if you want to just have a casual drink, perfect for an hour stop over.

The Shoppes at Venetian\/Palazzo provide you with an outlet to shop and are nice to just walk around and people watch. Many dining options are available in this area, as well as around the hotel.

One of my favorite parts of this resort is the pool.  As someone who frequents Vegas typically between May and August, having a large and beautiful pool is a must.  The pool is large, water temperature perfect, and drink\/dining service tremendous.  One good thing is you can use  both the Palazzo and the Venetian's pools, so if one is very crowded you can walk over to the other. 

Palazzo has been where we spent our  most recent trips and will be a likely destination for me in the future.
nice room,they lack of a buffet here,hot swimming pool A++

Had a cleaning lady steal my sun glasses. I contacted the hotel about it as soon as I realized they were gone and they just gave me a go around like "we checked, and none of our cleaning personnel have them." Just disgusting how you pay hundreds of dollars per night and still have some pos hotel employee steal your stuff. Disappointed more about the hotel management not caring than the cleaning lady.

Holy shit do I love the Palazzo! Just like the Venetian, the rooms are spectacular! I've stayed in a regular Luxury Suite here and the larger Sienna Suite. 

Between Venetian and Palazzo there is a lot to do. You can navigate the Canal shops, try over two dozen (24+) different bars or restaurants, do some gambling at either casino or just chill at Lagasse's Stadium to take in a Sunday of Football. Just like Venetian I could stay here for a week. It is very classy and well appointed.

After reading some of the reviews of the Palazzo ( aka. someone complaining because they were charged for taking something out of the mini fridge, LOL) I decided to write my own. 

I had walked through the Palazzo on a previous trip to Vegas, before I became the semi hardcore gambler that I now am , and loved it! I thought it was really nice and after seeing the pics and the size of the suites on the net .

We decided to book because we saw the summer suite package with some amenities ( voucher to Dos Caminos, Woo, Lavo, and slot credit) 
Just as a side note, we only used 1 of the vouchers- didn't even use the slot credit because their casino sucks but ill get on to that later. 

When we finally booked the rates came out to be about 345\/night from the 169 we had anticipated because we requested a room on a high floor with a view and didn't really want to leave it to chance. 

We got to the hotel around 12:30pm, checked in and even though there was a huge line our room was ready right away! First impression of the room was like... is this some kind of joke???? some of the things were definitely scuffed and had the price not been so high ( in my opinion) then i wouldn't have cared but in order to make this trip awesome for my boyfriend I didn't complain and immediately warmed up to the room.
