Now it's April 2014 and we walked in and our room was just fine. But room service did walk in while we were just relaxing and they apologized and walked out. Service was ok and the casino floor was fine. Nothing to rave about.

We arrived at 9 am on a Friday and they actually let us check-in that early. Room was huge and clean. No strange smells. The pool is great. Water stations, open only to hotel guests. If you want a lounge chair by the pool get here around 11:30. ( note this is an april stay).  Palazzo is actually in a really great location (especially for you club goers). It might not be the center of the strip, but there is still a ton around it.
My favorite place to stay when in Vegas.  Good service.  Clean rooms.  Beds are comfy   Would recommended to anyone that likes clean and good hotels

A few years back, this used to be the in place to stay. Today, it's not THE absolute place to be, but its still pretty decent. Not to mention they used to pretty much give comps away.

The rooms are all suite, so while the rooms might be typically  more on the pricey side, it becomes worth it if you're splitting it between friends. Rooms are furnished with good quality beds and materials, but you'll see better at other newer hotels. The couch doubles as a pullout bed that is surprisingly comfortble. Some of the furniture in the rooms also look a bit weathered now, but you should come to expect that from a Vegas hotel a few years old. Staff has always been nice and courteous. My last trip was rough, we didn't check out until 2 pm, and they waived us the late fee. That was definitely appreciated.

As far as things to do and places to eat. Lavo is nice, but a little on the low key side. Since Palazzo and Venetian are connected properties, you also have Tao, which I hate. The pools at both properties are nice, Palazzo's are on the chill side, but at Venetian you have the music blaring, fist pumping, juice head infested Tao beach. There are better pool parties to be had. Grand Lux is always a winner, but only the Venetian one is only one of the two that is open 24 hours. 

Palazzo and Venetian still have a special place in my heart because of all the insane times I've had at these places. Nowadays though, you can find nicer alternatives at other newer hotels.  If you're spitting a room between 4+ people though, this might be the best alternative for you.

Beautiful hotel. Everything is super clean and the staff is friendly. We were able to meet and interact with our house keeping lady and she's AWESOME! Super friendly and always had us returning to an over the top clean and spotless room!!! Best thing ever!

Minus one star because they don't offer complimentary water bottles like other hotels (their sister hotel Venetian even offers two bottles daily) which I found out at check out...which really was upsetting especially since it was $5 per bottle. We drank six (2 per day) so had a surprising $30 extra charge :( my fault for not checking and assuming though. 

Anyhow, I had the buy 2 nights get the 3rd free deal so can't complain too much since I did save quite a bit with this deal :)
I frequent this hotel when taking a mini-vacay. It's nice and affordable. Restaurants are pretty good. What more can I ask for

Disappointed to say the service failed to impress.  As the saying goes, looks can be deceiving.  It is truly a gorgeous and ginormous hotel, impeccable at that, but their service level could definitely be improved.

We checked in on a Friday night, and that went by fairly smoothly.  Fair warning though, it is a little bit of a walk from the check-in lobby to the elevators (if you don't travel light), otherwise it's a short walk across the casino.  

As soon as we entered our room, we noticed there were no bath towels, no toothbrushes, and only two hand towels (even though we had booked the room for 4 people).  I guess they didn't have time to restock the room or our room was overlooked.  Either way, we decided to give the lobby a call and we requested extra towels, blankets, toothbrushes, and slippers, which they promised would be delivered within 30 minutes.  

40 minutes later....still waiting...

60 minutes later...still waiting...

80 minutes later...still waiting...

We finally gave up and decided to call the lobby again.  After confirming our room #, we were told that the ticket order had already been closed because all of the requested items were delivered.  Honestly, I have no idea how that happened, seeing how we were just hanging out in our room the entire time and nobody knocked on our door or came in to deliver the so called amenities.  So they promised they would reopen the order and have it delivered on a "rush", meaning 15-20 minutes.  For the record, our items finally came 30 minutes later, bringing it to a total waiting time just shade under 2 hours.  Ridiculous.  

But besides that whole ordeal, it's a really nice and posh hotel.  The rooms are spacious, comfy, and their curtains block out any sunlight for when you just need to crash when you get back into your room at 6 AM and sleep after a night out.

It's also connected to the Venetian, and that is a whole other adventure in of itself.  If not for the minor hiccup with room service, it's one of the nicer (and newer) hotels on the strip!

If you love Venetian, Palazzo is the smaller quieter little brother. 

A lot less busy then Venetian. The rooms are exactly the same as Venetian but just renamed differently. They also have some of the same restaurants, Grand Lux!!! It also connects to Venetian as well.

Gambling was surprisingly really cheap for a Friday night. They had $10-$15 tables for most games. 

Only draw back is the location, your at the end of the strip. 

The Italian theme is so pretty. I never want to leave when I come. It is still one of my favorite places to stay in Vegas.
Enjoyed the suite rooms - tad bit out dated but overall comfortable and nice. The pool was great and the drinks weren't watered down... What else can you ask for?? :-)

I had a horrible check in experience. I hope this review helps you gain from my pain. Me and the bachelorette (don't ask; long story) had separate rooms. I booked on Expedia. She booked on Hotels. 

Yes, this is a pattern where the Palazzo hotel was cancelling third party booked reservations en masse. THe likelihood of both our reservations not going thru is very very low.

SO, when I checked in. My reservation was not visible. I had to call Expedia (very tough bc Expedia engineers friction into the customer service process). I had to call Expedia to have them repush the Expedia confirmed reservation thru to Palazzo's 'job duties department' (also known as trying to manage Memorial Day overbooking by being 104% overbooked)

Note: My expedia confirmation number was of no use.
Note: the hold time on Expedia was extraordinarily long

TIP: If you're booking directly on Palazzo's site, expect to pay more than double. 
TIP: If you're booking on Expedia, Priceline or Hotels, expect the hotel to disavow. Call Expedia 2-5 hours before you try to check in and say, "Hey Palazzo's job duties department does not have me in the system. Push my reservation thru again.

TIP Ideally, you would call palazzo and venetian from the McCarran tarmack because you're gonnna be on hold forever with 877-359-8474

TIP: I would call the Venetian Palazzo the night before and have them email you a confirmation. Do not accept a verbal confirmation. I got a verbal confirmation because I sent flowers to Jessica's room - See my Yelp review of the flowers https:\/\/twitter.com\/LarryChiang\/status\/870324992390680576

Get it in writing from Palazzo or you will be stuck at the front desk holding your shih tzu!

Finally, a hotel in Vegas with everything I've ever wanted. We stayed at the Palazzo this past Christmas weekend, and had a fantastic time staying in the Bella Suite. 

Our suite was crazy spacious and luxurious, with two queen beds and a separate lounge area with an enormous couch. There are TV's in the sleeping area, lounge area and even in the restroom. I may or may not have watched the news while showering. 

Parking is free, which is now a huge plus since all MGM and Caesars properties on the strip charge for it.  It's also insanely easy to get on and off the freeway from the Palazzo. Just exit and turn in in Sands - no driving on the strip required!

I'm definitely staying again at this place. It's worth spending the extra little bit to stay at a clean, newer hotel with great service. The rooms are large with sunken living rooms and beautiful views.

Had a great two days at the Palazzo.  We even popped for the "Prestige Package" so we didn't have to leave the hotel for any reason. And were treated like royalty by Michelle in the lounge area - wonderful mixologist and a very nice and fun lady.  Derrick at the concierge desk was SO helpful and kind.  Always remembered our name.

Room was wonderful, nice view.  Not of "The Strip" but a nice view of the golf course and the airport where we could watch the arrivals and departures as we sipped a drink.

We did have a few maintenance issues: TV  remote didn't work, one of the bathroom sinks had a drain problem.  ALL were  fixed immediately!

The only ding I can give is the lousy "shills" or 'hawkers" that jump at you the moment you slow down or have a minute interest in their windows.  VERY annoying and VERY much a scam.

I didn't get suckered in as we have them in local shopping centers in my California area.

But I did have some fun with them.  Let them put the $249.00 - "best price until midnight" miracle eye cream. They did the left eye and the bag under my left eye was gone.  Other eye was left untouched as a basis of comparison.  It had the SAME results as the stuff I buy at CVS or Walgreen's at $20.00 a bottle.

Wandered by later that night after I put the Walgreen's stuff on my other eye.  New guy that wanted to "wipe" off the stuff of my left eye (their stuff). Told him that was the result of his miracle product.  Walgreen's was still looking good on holding down the puffiness. 

He then changed the subject of the lines around my mouth.  Told him I really didn't care about them.  I earned those lines.....he just laughed and moved on to some other victim.

My recommendation is to not make eye contact with these shills. They are everywhere in Vegas. At the mall as well.

Stay at the hotel and enjoy a wonderful experience!

The Palazzo and the Venetian were so beautiful and grand.  So grand that you definitely need a map to navigate.  I can see its romantic, but slightly cheesy appeal over the more modern and theme less City Center.  We spend 3 nights here.  The suite was huge with a separate sitting area.  The bathroom was fancy and had a separate makeup vanity.  Service was typical of high caliber hotels.  You don't really see the room attendants, but they get the job done without being intrusive, unlike being woke up by loud door banging at the budget Luxor.  

There were a few things that I felt were below a 5 stars experience.  The sheets were low thread count and really rough.  The towels and robe were even more rough from being washed so many times.  The hotel provided  toiletries were not good quality.  The mini fridge was not usable since it was jam packed with bottles and will automatically charge to your room if you move them.

Five stars in my eyes.  Gorgeous property.  We had a room on a recently upgraded floor, maybe that bears stating, but everything was perfect.  Huge suite, seating\/desk area 2 steps down.  3 TVs, all worked flawlessly.  Excellent bedding, bathroom, etc.
This hotel is connected to the Venetian with 2 levels of great restaurants and high end shopping that most of us mere mortals avoid.  
The restaurant selection is amazing.  I wish I had more time here.  More expensive than at home but get over it.  (There are various price level choices - even Subway Sandwiches and Panda Express.)
Within an easy walk are the Wynn, Treasure Island, Mirage, and the Fashion Show shopping center.  I went to Treasure Island to play blackjack - much better table rules than Palazzo\/Venetian.
I walked through Wynn and Encore.  Also great properties but I didn't see the restaurant options I had.
There is a Walgreens between Palazzo and Venetian, street access only and you might miss it if you don't know.  Once inside, they have everything, and obviously cheaper than the hotel.  Great fruit, snacks, drinks, whatever.
excellent hotel had a great stay here for wine spectator tour last year. will be back!

The best hotel. So clean, such luxurious rooms and service.  I am dying to go back again.  We had adjoining suites too for 11 people and it was more than ample amount of room!

Also they have wonderfully delicious restaurants downstairs, a bridge that connects to the Wynn, connected to the Venetian, and right across from the Mirage Cravings Buffet.  What more could you ask for!?!

my husband and I stayed here 2 lovely nights last weekend. this place is becoming our favorite place to stay and play.  i signed up for the grazie loyalty..i hope they send me some offers..so i can go back soon.

First of all, like the Venetian, this is an "Asian hangout".  From Tao to 4 Chinese Restaurants to the Canal Shops, the whole joint appears to cater to Asian visitors.  So if you go, get ready for a lot of people that look like me joining you at the tables.

THE ROOM:
As a tourist:
--- REGISTRATION: Be sure to hand your driver's license to the registration desk clerk along with a $20 bill under it & ask for any upgrades available, preferably close to the elevators.  We got a fantastic view of the strip, the Las Vegas skyline, & the Sirens of TI show which includes fireworks.
--- BED:  The bed is better than Wynn's.  It doesn't move when you get into it, thus not waking up your partner if you're coming in to the room hypothetically at 4AM after hitting the tables for a long stretch.  BTW: 3 Flatscreen TV's adorn the unit.
--- FURNITURE:  The drapery\/blinds operate automatically via remote control & the attention to detail is just stunning from the carpet to the crown molding to the dark woods of the table tops.  There are detractors that call the décor "faux" but I don't agree, nor do I really care.  It looks good & it's comfortable so why hate?
--- ROOM SERVICE:  I love the Sands Room Service.  I've had most items on the menu.  Best Crab sandwich... ever.  Nuff said.
--- SHOWER: Water pressure is good & warms quickly!  Yay!

As a business traveler:  
--- POWER: There are ZERO power outlets near the office desk.  Call the front desk for a power strip & they'll bring you one.  
--- INTERNET:  Wired or wireless, the Internet connectivity is great.  Don't have room to explain why, but definitely more advanced than Venetian\/Wynn.
--- SAFE:  The room safe has a power outlet inside it.  Why?  Well, if you lock up your laptop, you can actually charge it in the safe.  Nice! 
--- SUITE:  The Palazzo suite doubles as a hospitality suite.  There's enough meeting space, coffee table room, & wet bar amenities to make it a great place to discuss business.  There's a DVD player there along with a 3 seat meeting table as well as a really nice sectional sofa & love seat wrapped around a coffee table.  It's a Venetian room on steroids. 
--- PRINTER:  The printer is an all-in-one inkjet w\/ both a fax line, copier\/scanner capability, & a USB cable to hook it up to your laptop to act as a personal printer for printing flight passes or show tickets.

ISSUES:  Verizon Wireless phone reception really blows from where we were at.

THE HOTEL:
First the good stuff:
--- SPA:  The Palazzo spa & facilities aren't quite built out yet, so you have to walk to the Venetian's Canyon Ranch Spa which is probably the best workout facility in Las Vegas.  They've got everything you need using top notch equipment & they have a great spa available to soak in afterwards.  The only problem is that you have to walk a few minutes just to GET there from the Palazzo, but all in all, it's worth it.
--- DEAL: There is a deal available called the "Resort Package" (http:\/\/www.palazzolasvegas.com\/resortpkg.aspx) which I recommend. 
ISSUES:  
--- POOL:  Something that bugged me more than I thought it would was the lack of availability of a 21 & over \/ topless pool like the Wynn had.  The reason for this is that the pool at the Venetian & the Palazzo has an inordinate number of KIDS.  & it's just downright hard to enjoy yourself once you've experienced the serenity of the Sunset pool at the Wynn. 
--- WOMEN'S BATHROOMS:  My poor wife.  There were long lines for women's bathrooms nearly everywhere we went.  Clearly, the Palazzo & the Venetian pools are 'at capacity' for women. (?)

THE RESTAURANTS:
In general, I don't care for the restaurants here.  "Woo" however is outstanding & makes up for a lot - see my review.  (I went to Cut, Table 10, Woo, Zine, Dos Caminos, Carnevino, Dal Toro)

THE CASINO:
The Palazzo has the SINGLE... WORST... CASINO... EVER!  The Palazzo Blackjack tables only play $25 EIGHT DECK SHOES with 70% penetration, no surrender, dealer hits on S17, DD on any two cards.  We fed $200 into the Palazzo slots at $1 machines playing max bet & got almost zero returns, zero bingos, & zero fun.  So everyday I would walk over to the Venetian & play my money there where the table rules are so much better. 

THE COMP SYSTEM:
The comp program - Club Grazie - is awful.  It's a slot club primarily. That being said, the invites from hours of table play are AWESOME.  My last invite was $200 in match play, 4 nights at the resort, $50 in dining credit, & a 2-for-1 pass for the spa.  And the best part is the invite is unlimited for this season.  I plan on calling in another trip next month. 

(I have a bigger review of Palazzo here:
http:\/\/kurtsthoughts.spaces.live.com\/blog\/cns!97895BBB8AD10F37!962.entry)

SUMMARY:
Unless you REALLY want to gamble in your own hotel, this is a great resort for its rooms & amenities... and it's invites.  I'll be back as long as they'll have me.

5-stars.

Gorgeous lobby! Suite setup is the same as Venetian, afterall it is an extension of Venetian.  I don't particularly like this hotel better than Venetian but do like the casino better. Not that I play a lot, but I do play the slot machine.  Casino is not as crowded thus you can find spots where there are no smokers around.  Like their coffee shops- food court.  wait a minute am I confused is the food court in Venetian. oh well!  Stayed 2 nights at the Palazzo, got stuck in the snow storm and came back to check in Venetian. That's why I am confused.

Love the atmosphere and feel of this hotel\/Casino. I know there's other high end casinos to love but this place has all the goodies like the Grand Luxe Cafe, Spanish 21, Lavo and we've won here! Hehe. Give em a try and get the Grazie card... You'll get some rooms comped.

The rooms at the Palazzo are quite luxurious and spacious. The bathroom is huge. Comfortable bed - although the pillows are somewhat small. Internet service is fast & reliable (which is becoming rare in hotels). The coach in the tv area is huge and comfortable. The casino is practically smokeless. You can spent the entire night there and your clothes won't smell like smoke. Decent eats. Overall great experience.

The Palazzo is my home away from home!

No, seriously.
I only stay here when I visit Las Vegas from northern California several times a year. 
(Prior to their opening 4 years ago, I stayed at the Venetian). 

Wanna know why? 

-The suites are beautiful. 
-My views have always been incredible.  
-The staff treats me like VIP (but that could be based upon my gameplay). ;)
-Fabulous restaurants (though I'm still sad Dos Caminos closed). 
-Great Player's Club perks. 
-Private VIP rooms within the casino between both the Venetian and Palazzo. 
-Exceptional pools and cabanas. 
-Friendly housekeepers. 
-Access to multiple retail shops and other hotels. 

I'm always sad to leave the resort and cannot wait to return...
But I will be "home" again in October! 

Best. Hotel. In. Las. Vegas.

Things I did in a Vegas hotel room that I have never done before:

a. Watch Jacques Pepin and a Taiwanese cooking show while brushing my teeth in the bathroom. 
b. Use a remote control to adjust the shades in both the living room and bedroom.
c. Use 5 showerheads in the shower all at once, with one setting at massage, and the others striking various points on my body
d. Call down to the front desk while walking throughout the three large rooms.
e. Sit on a couch and entertain about 6 other friends in the living room.
f. Push open a double entry doorway into a magnifcent foyer.
g. Sit at a vanity and do my make-up with different light settings AND a magnifying mirror.
h. Never touch the temperature control setting once. NOT ONCE. The temperature was perfect throughout our stay.
i. Sit in the VIP lounge and eat and drink for free 24 hours a day. FOR FREE.

BEAUTIFUL. Amazing property that I have been privileged to have stayed at twice already this year.

I got the first one as a timeshare deal - go watch a timeshare presentation, and get 2 nights in Vegas at the Palazzo... WIN

Second time was with friends - beware, if you use the minibar, you can expect the bill to be almost as much as the room charge - if not more! Utilize CVS, or learn the hard way!

Great amenities, just a bit irksome that they do not have locks on their bathroom doors.

This hotel has beautiful rooms and some of the staff were very nice. But I stayed here a week and overall the customer service was horrible...that just really killed my stay. Hate it wish I could give it a better rating.

Stayed here for two nights. I think its a good deal for sure. There are some things to note though:
1) The rooms have soaps and lotion that are very perfume'ish. Left my skin mad dry. So bring your own if you're a hippy like me. 
2) No fridge to store your stuff. 
3) The $25 cost to use the spa is well worth it. Very very relaxing. 
4) They have two gyms will full on free weights, squat rack, bench press, etc. Much better than any hotel's I've been to. 
5) No buffet. So you'll have to get your snack on somewhere else if you're mad hungry. 
6) The Walgreens in the building comes in very handy for cheap water bottles (the canteen in the casino charges $8 for a bottle).
Some good some bad but overall I think its a good spot.

Grandma rocks! This past weekend she got me and the hubby a room here all on comps! It was nice and roomy for us both. Our bathroom was lovely and i really liked the setup. The shades that adjusted by remote were neato and the cool basket of goodies were awesome (hello aveda!) I was so grateful that we stayed here for free. It was a nice and clean place. The comforter was a duvet with a cover! Finally a hotel understands that they should do that so they can just take the duvet off and wash it after a guest checksout! Our view was amazing and I swear I would pass out every night I went to bed and awoke so refreshed. The only drawback is the pool filled with a bunch of douchebags. And what is up with people putting chairs in the pool? It was crowded like mad and was not enjoyable....maybe i act like an old lady even though I am far from it. I also passed on the spa because it looked crowded and had a feeling it would of sucked just like the pool. So 3 stars for room and 1 star for spa\/pool area. I know tao is here....but i just find the whole club scene stupid. I guess next time i need an old people place...=)

The D. family are not big on much. We really like free things, though. Free booze and food especially. We stayed on the Prestige Level during our recent Vegas vacation. 

Pros- free booze from 5-8pm each night. free breakfasts from 7-10am.  Delicious appetizers, pastas, desserts. COMFORTABLE beds. LARGE rooms. 3 tvs. Attached to the Venetian Pools. Comfy robes. Very clean!

Cons- bartenders were rude to me and my boyfriend. Like, WTH seriously?? No room at the pools, had to head to Venetian. Had to order a hair dryer.

Overall, I'd totally stay here again.

First thing you do when you get to the Palazzo or Venetian: Get a player's club card. Second thing you do: Start gambling and get those comps. 

The Palazzo is definitely one of the better hotels in Vegas, room-wise. Not too old, the bathrooms are nice and big and it's real spacious in general. For the most part,  it's like the other Vegas hotels. What sets it apart though is the amount of room you get. The only place I liked better was the Wynn or was it Encore? One of those. In any case, this is one of the better hotels to stay at. Plus, there's a Walgreens down below if you ever get thirsty and it's really close to Wynn\/Encore. No more walking the entire length of the strip when you come stumbling out of XS at 4 in the morning.

Gorgeous suites that's standard. Everything feels like luxury, and its connected to Venetian which has such great ambiance.  My only gripe is that its a little further in from Venetian so there's a bit more walking to do when coming from the other part of the strip. Otherwise, it's one of the best places to stay.

The hotel rooms are beautiful. The view was alright. We had room 36807 so we had the view of the high roller. 
We are nocturnal and go to sleep early morning. Like 6am and were able to sleep in. No noise from hallway was heard nor from housekeeping. It was a great 4 day stay!

So gorgeous but super expensive. I love all the classy shops around it and the Casino on it's first floor. Everything is fancy and obvious about it. It also has a Walgreens and Sephora connected to it, and they're not over priced, believe it or not, so ladies no worries if you forget any makeup at home!!! haha

Maybe on my next adventure this is where I'll stay! It's literally in the middle of the Strip. Woot Woot! :]

The Palazzo is the sister hotel next to the Venetian,  located on The Strip.  This hotel is huge and all the rooms are suites. This last stay we were fortunate to get a room with a strip view. I love this view especially at night when it's all lit up with lights. 

The rooms are spacious with a separate living area. The coolest thing is that the drapes open up and close by remote. The drapes block out all the light, so you can sleep in after staying up all night in the "city that never sleeps" :-) The living room couch also opens up to a bed if you have children or more guests. The bath room is huge with a separate shower and tub, 2 sinks, a make-up area, and private toilet area. All rooms come with a stocked refrigerator  (don't move anything unless you want to be changed ) a safe, and 2 robes for use at the pool. The room also comes with 3 flat screen TVs! 

The room is clean, the toiletries are luxurious quality,  and the beds are comfortable.  Service is excellent, and the staff will do all they can to meet your needs. 

The Lobby is beautiful at check-in and valet service is available. Be sure to take the walkway to the Venetian and see the decor and waterfalls. You may even catch a wedding taking place :-) There are many excellent restaurants to try and high end shopping available.

We did have a few problems with the casino.  We were there when the time changed from daylight savings time and all the slot machines had a problem.  We wanted to check out our money and everyone had to be hand paid. We had to wait over an hour. We also had trouble with the slot service a few other times. The drink service has also gone down hill. They are not serving the top shelf drinks like they use to and are no longer serving Fiji water. It takes forever to get a drink,  even just water and we felt some of the waitresses were not friendly. It's sad to see theses services go downhill and makes "the player" feel like they are no longer important.  Many of the casinos seem to be catering more to "the club crowd" today. We also feel the machines were not registering and keeping track of our play correctly.  The numbers they gave us did not match ours! I would give this hotel 5 stars if it wasn't for all the problems we had in the casino. 

I am disappointed that there are no coffee makers in any of the rooms.  However, they do give you a free cup of coffee at La Presse coffee located between the Palazzo and Venetian.  Depending on who is working, they may give you a refill for free. I still think it would be nice if they add the coffee makers to each room. However, I still highly recommend this hotel if you want to feel pampered and special.  It's wonderful and I will be back.

As always (and despite my political leanings), I am a fan of the Palazzo.  It is an absolutely beautiful property with lots of natural light and a great ventilation system, so you don't feel as though you're breathing through an ash tray.

I have also, and continue to be, impressed by the friendly and professional customer service.  I was checked in quickly, given a high floor with a partial Strip view as well as a coupon book and offers for the various restaurants and shops.

And the rooms!! Gorgeous suites with comfortable beds, a huge sectional sofa, two flat screen tvs, remote controlled blinds, huge bathroom with marble everywhere, a soaking tub, separate water closet and wonderful shower.  Everything was spic and span and even smelled freshly cleaned when we walked into the room.

I may not like the politics of the Palazzo, but darnit, they sure do know how to design and run a hotel! Bravo!

The Palazzo just screams SEXXX.

It was quite possibly, the best hotel I've ever stayed at.

Our suite was spectacular, with a Strip view, and we could watch the Treasure Island show each and every night from our window.  The beds and couches were to die for, the room service impeccable, and we had free wi-fi in our room.  Bravo to whoever the interior designer was.

I mean....even our curtains had their own remote control.

Not that we needed THREE televisions, but we had them.  The bathroom was HUGE, and several people could be getting ready at the same time if you needed to.  The toilet also had it's own separate room, which we all appreciated.  Nothing ruins your vacay more than when someone blows up the bathroom.

The concierge was also fabulous as well and SUPER nice..  We needed last minute tickets to a show at the Excalibur, and we got them without a hitch.

So if you want, POSH and POLISH, definitely stay here!!!

After going to Vegas numerous times and staying at the Encore, now we remember why. Be forewarned, yes, this will sound nit picky. Why? Because it's supposed to be 5 stars, we have no idea why. 5 stars=allowance for picky!

Check in was great, perhaps due to no line and were routed to VIP check in. Sadly, the VIP above and beyond treatment ended at the VIP desk. Our room was spacious and clean. We enjoyed the layout but not so much the large breadcrumbs left over in the waste basket. I don't need to know the previous guest enjoyed garlic bread. 
The dining was enjoyable, however. I LOVE Illy coffee and they had it, SW is our favorite steak house and Cut was comparable other than letting in some hobo-esque diner in a hoodie and Tevas. HOODIE AND TEVAS PEOPLE!!!! As if I want to pay that much to stare at people who meandered in half drunk from not getting enough food at McDs. Luckily his granny picked up the tab for him. 
We aren't huge gamblers but enjoyed a night of blackjack, other than the pit boss who was as entertaining as a court jester. He conveniently overly chatted with hubby when he was winning and mysteriously disappeared as soon as hubby started losing until I said to quit getting distracted. We aren't there to gamble as serious people.  But come on now. Pit jester physically grabbed hubby's chips to give dealers a "tip" with all of his chips, after the umpteenth time that got obnoxious. We are very good tippers, by no means were we skimping on the dealer and waitress. The dealers and servers were prompt and friendly and at least didn't swipe chips. Not funny pit boss. Get your own chips. Speaking of swiping, I purposefully put all of our ones for tipping valets and such in a single bank envelope, stashing it between two maps. Apparently the maids enjoy swiping as much as the pit bosses do because our money was stolen. I 100% know this because I kept track and checked each time we returned to our room. So unless you want your chips and tips stolen, lesson learned, use the safe. My bad for trusting 5 star hotel staff. You're welcome for the $40 tip ladies. :\/
Don't stay here unless you enjoy family friendly hotels. Who totes tots to VEGAS? I almost ran down a dozen in the casino area. Please stay somewhere that has a circus parents. There is one not away. It has video games, not just video poker.

The Moroccan style street vendors peddling $400 collagen eye cream was incredibly annoying and unavoidable since they are outside of the elevators. No, I don't want your Chiclets. If my skin is so "amazing" why are you following me with free samples? The other stores are awesome! Christian Loubitin always satisfies. But, they aren't owned by the Palazzo. 

Even though we requested turn down on the first night to be done nightly they only remembered once. I wouldn't call a sachet of two chocolates and closing the curtains turn down when you aren't actually turning anything down. Not a huge fan of the jet engine style room fan coming on every 10 minutes. If I wanted to hear a sound resembling a jet, I'd stay at an airport HoJo. On the upside, the valets, dining, shops, and casino staff (other than the giant jester) were great. The public areas were clean aside from dropped pacifiers and stuffed animals. 
At the end of the trip after charging well over 2k to the room and gambling for hours we got ZERO comps. Zero. Nil. Niet. Nein. No can dooskey on comps so unless you spent a ridiculous amount don't bother, although if you enjoy being scoffed at, feel free to ask Theresa for comps. "Unless you play $50 per hand for at least 4 hours per day you will not be comped anything." Thanks Theresa. Manager of casino hosts. After 6 nights and 7 days you'd think a free 8oz of my favorite Illy wouldn't be asking for too much. Bummer. You were warned. Not having access to my VPN thanks to hotel internet blocking (I called and asked) I was forced to chew up my own personal cell hotspot data while Palazzo chewed up my daily room fee that included "free wifi". Why bother? Being given an extra fridge for my husband's insulin was accommodating and well appreciated. Especially since we got charged $8 for something in the mini fridge we never used. Maybe the maids also had a Fiji water. 

My husband and I agree that what makes a hotel 5 stars is service. Unfortunately, that is what the Palazzo lacked. Lesson learned, we will be going back to Encore again. And again.

An extremely nice place to pass out in and be hung over the next morning. 

The bathroom was large but kind of sucked -- the shower leaked all over the place and the door to the "toilet room" slams shut (but has no lock).

My favorite part, aside from the fact that you can comfortably sleep six people in the room, was the peacock-blue settees at the foot of the beds. Que elegante!

Nice hotel with good front desk service, spacious suites and above-average in-suite dining; however, their housekeeping is just not up to par. 
During our seven night stay, we experienced: 1) housekeeping entering our suite without warning, 2) housekeeping not coming even though the cart was right outside our door servicing the room across from us as we left for the day [do not disturb sign was not on our door handle], 3) housekeeping not removing neither suite-provided glasses nor our trash [empty soda\/milk bottles] from our dining table, and 4) housekeeping not doing basic things like dusting and wiping off surfaces. I took pics of the dusty and hairy headboard in our suite ... pretty gross. It appears as though it has been months since a thorough cleaning has been done, at least in suite #43-922. And, now that I think about it, at no time during our week-long stay did I hear a vacuum running ... hmmm.
I will say that the in-suite dining service and food was very good, expensive but good. Would recommend the corned beef hash & eggs, chicken and waffles, and the Greek yogurt & fruit parfait.

Textured swirly carpet. Luxurious dark chocolate tones with creamy white. My kinda decor. Marble and granite and plush velvet. All kinds of wonderful.

Palazzo is like the Venetian's little fresh, innocent sister, unspoiled ... well mostly anyway, it IS Vegas. It opened in Jan 2008, so it's really quite new still, the rooms still have a good feel to them.

I love these little spinoff hotels like THE hotel for Mandalay .. and Palazzo for Venetian. It's a little quieter, less hectic, less people, less SMOKY. A little bit more personal. Three LCD TV's in the suite, I mean how can you go wrong?

Hard to pull off in Vegas, but it givess off the right vibe of sophisticated yet comfortable. Connects to the Venetian for easy access to all of their shops, restaurants, conference center. Very helpful and accommodating staff. 

Slow wi-fi though, they gotta beef that up for sure...makes it frustrating when you have 30 minutes in the room between meetings and dinner and you have to actually try to conduct some business.

Fabulous stay.

So, when someone offers you a complimentary room at the Palazzo, TAKE IT!  Man, this hotel had everything!!  

The hotel is so luxurious!  The rooms are so spacious!  Granite everywhere, it's so posh!  There was so much room for a family of 5.  Everything is gorgeous and every room has a t.v.!  My 4 yo son asked me, "Mama, why is there a t.v. in the bathroom?"  I told him is was so he could watch SpongeBob while taking a shower!  His eyes lit up!

My kids loved the fact that they could watch the Pirate Show at Treasure Island just across the street every night.  And the pools at the Palazzo were awesome.  We basically would eat breakfast, head to the pool, eat lunch, head back to the pool, have dinner and we were back in the pool again!

I enjoyed the shopping mall that connected the Venetian to the Palazzo, you can just stay there and never have to endure the Las Vegas heat!  

The only reason why I'm giving the Palazzo 4 stars out of 5 is because they charged us a $50 restocking fee even though we didn't have anything from the in room fridge.  My kids were playing with the items and didn't put them back EXACTLY as how it was left.  So WARNING, don't touch the fridge!

You seriously don't need to go anywhere else!  We stayed for 3 days and it was the best and most relaxing 3 days in Vegas I've ever had!

Hotels freak me out!!!!!!!!!!  The thought of staying in a PUBLIC BEDROOM is not appealing to me. Vegas is nasty too. But in situations where you have no other choice but to stay in a Vegas hotel The Palazzo is probably a better choice from the selection.

First off, the hotel is BEAUTIFUL. It is a newer hotel that has a grand lobby, impressive architecture, and nice decorations. The staff is friendly and they are attentive at the elevators to prevent random people from going up to the suite floors\/pool. It is not too crowded especially since I was there on a busy weekend. The price for this hotel is slightly expensive but if you book your suite early you can definitely find a good deal. 

The hotel is situated within walking distance of several hotels including the Venetian (they're connected), The Mirage, Treasure Island, and Caesar's Palace. Taxis are also efficient in this city. 

Definitely my favorite hotel I've stayed at in Vegas. But realize that I have only been at Circus Circus and Tropicanna. Lol. :(

We stayed here a second time with a group of 8 for a bachelor party. I love that they did adjoining suites so we could freely go between suites. This hotel is great for large groups and has tons of restaurants and bars inside the hotel and nearby (XS across the way at the Wynn).

Palazzo is hands down my favorite hotel on the strip! My cousin and I were both in Vegas at the same time. She stayed at MGM and paid the same amount for a room half the size. Palazzo has such a friendly staff, huge rooms, and amazing decor. Can't wait to comeback!
very nice stay here i like the rooms but i think the wynn is the nicest so far

I'm late in writing this review, but I wanted to say what a wonderful stay I had at The Palazzo the week of September 11th. My visit was in honor of my mother - a surprise birthday trip - and we had a blast. The front desk check- in was friendly, and our room was given a complimentary upgrade. The suite was beautiful, and my mother was blown away at how luxurious it was. I would definitely return to stay here in the future.

I go to Vegas a countless amount of times each year and have stayed at Venetian\/Palazzo at least 5 times over the past year. The hotel\/casino is top-notch and very detailed in every aspect. They clean and scrub areas of the hotel regularly and it shows. I've seen staff clean and scrub the restrooms and the lobby areas late at night and early mornings. People spill drinks at the casino table (me haha) and they have tissues to clean it up immediately. Everyone is very courteous here.

The rooms are spacious; every room has a separate sitting area with its own TV and a sofa that may or may not be a pullout bed. The bathroom has a separate tub and walk-in shower, 2 sinks, and a private toilet behind a door. All of this makes it convenient, so someone can be using the toilet while others could get ready using 2 sinks. There is also a chair and table for ladies to make their face in the bathroom. If someone is using the bathroom, there is a mirror in the foyer for the ladies to make their face :)

During 2 separate visits, we encountered some problems. The first is that we gave the bellman our luggage, which were separated into multiple tickets. When we called for it, they only delivered luggage belonging to 1 ticket and marked our room as "done" in their system. Two hours later, after multiple inquiries and being given the run-around, we went downstairs to retrieve the luggage ourselves and had to wait in the lobby while they looked for it. About 1 hour after picking up our luggage, we received a call checking up on the issue; they resolved it by offering us a $50 dining credit.

The second time, we checked into our room to find a used cup, body print on the bed, pillows laid out, a used towel, and a dirty tub. It looked as if someone accessed the room, took a nap, and washed up before leaving. We got switched to a new room immediately. About 1 hour after the incident, we received a call about the issue and they offered us complimentary internet access to make up for it.

The customer service is amazing. They are quick and eager to resolve issues to the best of their abilities. Love love love this hotel. Definitely my #1 out of all the hotels in Vegas.

The location is towards the north end. The view is usually of the swimming pools or mountains, not the best strip view. These may be negatives for some, but the luxury details, feel, comfort, and service makes it the best place to stay! This is not one of those hit-or-miss hotels! You can't go wrong with any room. The lobby usually has decorations and there is easy access to many restaurants. It is connected to the Grand Canal Shoppes & The Venetian. Have you seen the gondolas? The crowd is a mixture of older and younger, those seeking a relaxing getaway as well as those wanting to party, since there is the best gym\/spa here as well as Tao Nightclub. Parking at Palazzo is easy, whether using valet or self parking.

***The Palazzo is expensive, but it often features reasonable room rates on non-busy weekends; the rooms are nice and the all-suites approach is perfect if you are planning on taking a Las Vegas trip with a big group of friends***

The Palazzo (attached to The Venetian) is one of the largest casinos in Las Vegas and it features luxurious rooms.  All of the rooms are also suites, which means you get a nice big bed and a comfortable living room with large couches and tables.  The space, the plentiful seating and the luxurious touches and decor accents throughout the room make The Palazzo the perfect spot for a pre-night gathering with a big group of friends.

The room is comfortable too (both in terms of furniture and room temperature).  The bathroom is nice as well and quite spacious with both a soaking tub and a glass shower.  It was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed at though I personally prefer The Cosmopolitan due to its younger vibe and balconies in some rooms.

I did not get to check out much of the amenities like the fitness center and the pool, but there are many good dining options in the hotel with plenty of upscale breakfast and lunch spots as well as a Bouchon Bakery just downstairs.  A big chain pharmacy is also attached to the casino.

In terms of the location, The Palazzo is pretty good.  I personally prefer to be closer to Caesars, Bellagio and The Cosmopolitan, but The Palazzo is not too far north.

Service was good and pleasant.

Room rates are often high, but their room rates are typically not as expensive as Aria, The Cosmopolitan, Wynn, or Encore.  In addition, there are a few weekends during the year (if you do your research) where you can get a room at The Palazzo at a great rate.

I really enjoyed my stay at The Palazzo and it would be one of my first choices on The Strip if I was staying in Las Vegas with a big group of people.  The space coupled with the luxurious touches make this a great place for a weekend stay.  It can also make for an iconic Las Vegas stay and experience.

Like most major casinos on The Strip, parking is free.

We found someone's dirty underwear in our room!

Customer service also failed! They told us that they would bring up the keys to our new room...We waited an hour and nothing, went down and got the keys ourselves.

Missed our dinner reservations due to them saying someone was on their way up to the front desk and we didn't have to go down.

One of my new favorite hotels.

I could probably nit-pick and give this hotel 4 starts like the overall rating, but I have to say overall I just had an amazing stay with my friends.

Parking is free and easy.
They let us check in hours early for free. Staff was friendly and nice.
Layout of the hotel and casino was nice - connects easily to the Venetian.
I don't gamble much but it seemed like there were a lot of nice slots and open tables.

My favorite part of the hotel though is the rooms! The Bella Suites are where it's at!
I slept 6 dudes in one room comfortably! Two queen beds and a living room area. Just overall the value of the room was unbeatable and made the whole trip experience for me pretty amazing. I've stayed at the Wynn and Encore and many other nice hotels. The Palazzo isn't as classy or as upscale as the Wynn, but it doesn't have to be. It hits a perfect spot in-between class\/style\/affordability.

Definitely will come back.

Avoid this hotel like the plague. it took over 3 hours to exit the parking garage on a busy day. Hotel  staff were indifferent. All they could say is that long waits were common.

There are plenty of nicer and more effectively staffed properties in Las Vegas. Avoid this one!

DATE: Wednesday, Feb 4, 2009 - Saturday, Feb 7, 2009
ROOM TYPE: Bella Suite
LENGTH OF STAY: 3 nights
RATE: $142.04\/night after taxes @ hotwire.com

___________________________________


We were lucky to have had such an awesome person at the check-in counter when we stayed there. We had a lengthy conversation regarding all the Cirque du Soleil productions, gossiped a little about Steve Wynn and the corporate break-up that led to the birth of Le Reve, and traded tips on the fabulous celebrity chef restaurants. He assured me that dinner at Joel Robuchon would be "the best meal of my life" (as it was his and many others before him) and gave me a list of a few unknown casual off-Strip eateries commonly frequented by visiting celebrity chefs, sommeliers (Robert Parker), and Cirque du Soleil performers. (I assure you, losing that list was not fun.)

By the end of the conversation, he had upgraded us to the Palazzo Bella, with a view of the Strip. I realize it's not "the best room in the resort," but it was beautiful just the same, and wonderful coming back to such a clean, spacious, and comfortable room every night after all that walking around the Strip followed by dinners and shows.. The bathtub was big enough for two to relax in, and the sitting area allowed us to sit and chat over bubbly whenever we wanted.. We had 2 LCDs in the actual bedroom, and another one in the bathroom. All requests were quickly addressed, and the housekeeping staff do an incredible job keeping the place virtually spotless.

The location is ideal, being next to the Wynn and across(ish) the Treasure Island and Mirage.

The property itself is, as any of us familiar with Vegas know, beautiful.

I had an incredible time.

[ 200 ]

A great place to stay like the Venetian, the Palazzo is about perfect and is my standard to judge other hotel\/casinos. The rooms have remote control drapery, 3 TVs, luxurious living room space, a table to dine, and a DVD player. That's just the basic room. It has great places to eat: Trattoria Reggiano, Sushisamba, Cut, Delmonico, Bouchon, Noodle Asia, and Buddy V's. The views from any room are good to phenomenal. The pool is fun and has some good looking people basking in the LV sun. Don't buy your drinks at the pool. The gym is excellent. Don't forget the Gold Room, Club Prestige, Paiza Club, and getting your points at the Grazie player's club. The beds are comfortable cloud-like cushions. The in-room business desks are great to log in to work. The basic suites can sleep 5 with 2 queens and sectional sleeper sofa. The Fusion Bar is cool with great mixologists. Just be careful of the events manager from the player's Grazie Club. 

The Grazie casino club offers great comps. Be sure to use it when charging to your room and purchasing retail merchandise in the shoppes areas. Status points will grow fast. I was invited to several comped $50,000 slot tournaments over 2 years. Then I had the disfortune to meet this woman at the 2014 Halloween slot tournament. Despite this hiccup, I really like the Palazzo.

March 2016 update
The gyms are fantastic. Patrick, the gym attendant, was very accommodating with fresh towels, equipment assistance, and cups of water. We got a room on the 44th floor with The Strip view. Be sure to use the Invited Guest line at check-in if your room was comped. Stay at the Venetian if you want a party atmosphere or the Palazzo for a quieter stay.

A newer version of the Venetian next door, the Palazzo features cozy, super-sized hotel rooms that have a "sunken" living room\/sitting area and a core sleeping area, each with its own TV, as well as large, immaculate bathrooms with both shower and soaking tub. Given that the living room has a huge sofa of its own, you could conceivably stuff up to 4 people in a single room and still have breathing space to spare. 

The views can be especially glorious if you're on a high floor with a view of the Strip, and the overall feel is comfortably but accessibly high-end. The gym is compact but decently equipped, and service and security were quite decent. All in all, a very pleasant way to relax and decompress from the hustle bustle of the Strip.

This place has always been a great hotel and is one of the best. However, today I did have a moth situation. We had to kill 2 moths and I couldn't help to think that there maybe more and is unsanitary.

FANTASTIC!!!  I was so impressed with this hotel.  the lobby is beautiful and everyone was very friendly.  the room...awesome!  i felt like i was kind of in the rain man suite!  so cool!  the service there is awesome.. the guy who helped with the bags was so nice and helpful and went and got us ice!  the bags came before we could even call and whenever we called for something we had it very quickly. 
the room was huge, couch, gigantic bathroom (big enough for 4 girls to get ready at the same time), 3 flat screen tvs and one of my friends was so stoked on the full length mirror!  One cool thing...the blinds have a remote...i know..cool right!!!   quick elevators...my only complaint was the nutso prices on bottles of water...crazy!  $3.50 for a bottle of crystal geyser or something....not happening!  
I will take any opportunity i have to stay again at the Palazzo.

Just came back from our stay in Las Vegas, December 21-23.  Stayed at the Bellagio, Las Vegas last year with our family and loved it.  Thought we would stay at the Venetian this year as this is also a 5 star hotel.  There were no rooms available upon our early (11 AM) arrival at the Venetian, so we were offered two identical "Venetian type rooms" in the Palazzo Hotel, which is part of the Venetian.  The rooms were big and spacious.  We found them very comfortable.  Great view of the mountains, lots of room for 4 adults (we occupied 2 rooms with 4 occupants in each room), and we were given rooms on the same floor to make things more convenient for all of us. The view from the 39th floor was beautiful and the rooms were very quiet.  If there were people in the rooms adjacent to us, we didn't know it.  We received complimentary continental breakfast tickets at the Grand Lux Cafe.  You could upgrade to their Breakfast Buffet for an additional $8.50 per person, which we did.  It was well worth it as our family loved the breakfast buffet.  They had a great variety of food and it was all very tasty!

We paid a resort fee of $17 plus tax per room per night ($19.04); not quite sure what the fee covered, but it included internet and printer usage.  I had no problem with the fee as I was informed of it "up front" when we made our reservations.

What ensued caused me to downgrade their rating to a 4.  The printer in my room was out of ink and had no USB plug to connect to my laptop for printing.  I was told they would replace the ink cartridge in my room but I would have to pay $10 for the USB plug if I wanted to print anything.  I informed them that there was no USB plug when I entered the room, so why was I required to pay for something that should have been attached to the printer upon my arrival?  They informed me they were sorry, but Palazzo occupants had been taking their USB plugs and they would have to charge the next occupant for it if they wanted to use the printer.  It would cost me $10 and I could keep the USB plug when I left.  I found it incredulous that they would make me pay for something that they should be providing as a service that I already paid for. I did not buy their USB cable.  Instead, I went to our son's room, where they had a USB cable connected to their printer, and printed our boarding tickets for our flight back home from their room. 

Other than the incident with the USB cable, we had a great time at the Palazzo.  Their shops were great, the canal was beautiful, the staff was very polite and helpful, and the location of the hotel enabled us to leave our rented van in the garage so we could walk to most of our destinations on the strip.  We would stay there again.  However, next time, I will bring a USB cable with me to connect to the printer in my room in the event the same thing happens again.  

One other note:  There is a 24 hour Walgreen's located right at the corner of the Palazzo.  People packed the place buying drinks, snacks, and other "essentials" that would have cost many times that if you purchased it at the Palazzo.  For instance, a package of 'M&M' candy at the Palazzo would cost $9; it would cost you $6 for a small bottle of Fuji water from your room.  You could buy those items for many times less than that at Walgreens.

The Best. My husband and I love staying at the Palazzo for many reasons. Beautiful suites with extremely comfy beds for one thing; large tubs, marble showers for another. Large closets fit everything we pack and house those white fluffy robes I love so much.

Valet parking is quick, easy and efficient. The service is impeccable. Guest services, bellhops, check-in people are accommodating and polite. Best of all, the room rates are EXTREMELY reasonable compared to any other hotel in its class. Visited a room that cost twice as much in the Bellaggio which was half the size of our palatial suite at palazzo and would NEVER trade.

Pros: WiFi in every room; 3 tvs; pools; Canyon Ranch; attached to the Venetian, another excellent property; GORGEOUS; large clean suites; outstanding service.

Cons: ? Can't stay here forever I guess. Sometimes we have to go home.

Wonderful stay! The front desk people gave us a little care package when we arrived, since we always forget our toothbrushes and toothpaste, it was a big help!

The room itself was beautiful including the bathroom, I was seriously shocked!

Also, I loved the remote operated blinds, they really made my mornings a lot easier since they were blackout shades :)

This is my absolute favorite hotel in LV.  It beats out my second favorite, Wynn, simply because the rooms are bigger with the sunken living room which has a pull out sofa bed.  So if you're broke like some of my friends, you can easily share this room among 6 people, if you get two queen beds.  The bathrooms are also very spacious.  It's a beautiful hotel and casino with all the high end ammenities expected.  It's easier to navigate than The Venetian (see my review).  It's simply beautiful.

Stayed at the Palazzo for a crazy Halloween weekend in Vegas. 

With almost no deals that weekend, being that the Cigar Convention AND that is was Halloween, we were going to pay a pretty penny anywhere we went. At least at the Venetian and Palazzo, you get a little suite with your room. 

I've stayed at the Venetian, and the Palazzo definitely feels like a mini upgrade. The building is newer, the rooms are modern-chic, and the room had a total of three tvs. One in the bathroom! 

I got to shower, while watching the Rocky Horror Picture Show, on Halloween. You can't beat that!!

Room service was fast and pretty affordable. The beds were very comfy, and the couch could have held 2 extra party crashers on it. The parking was confusing at first, but after one time, it's easy.
The hotel itself is beautiful.  Beware, however, of barely-older-than-teenaged parties who yelp in the hallway at 3am, combinations of laughter, tears, and expletives. After all, this is Las Vegas.

This weekend...crazzzyyyy!!!! party like a rockstar!!!

So a couple of friends & I took an all girl Vegas vacation & booked a room @ the Palazzo...the room Insanely beautiful & huge....2 huge beds...jacuzzi bathtub, see through glass shower, 3 flat screens..1 in the bathroom while you soak in the tub or get your shower on..1 in front of the beds, and 1 down the 2 stairs in your own private living room!!! yes what a great way to hype up the weekend

The curtains close up & down with just the push of a button. & there is a ledge in the room for cat walk  runway status for showing off those scandalous outfits heck yes this is my favorite place to stay 

I love the palazzo will come back to party it up again & rock out to my song of the weekend

p.s. valet & luggage service oh yeah!


**forget about your boyfriend & meet me @ the palazzo you can bring your girlfriends & meet me at the palazzo*** what a great weekend!

I recently stayed at the Palazzo again, this time during the warmer months when the pool is open.  Yes, the pool area is lacking.  It's a nice pool area, for sure, but the servers are slow (sometimes non existent) and the pool is in the shadow of the hotel for the majority of the day.  It doesn't really matter since you can walk over to the Venetian pools (about a 3 minute walk) and Tao Beach, both of which have ample sunlight.  

Again, our room was fantastic, with a great view of the completed pools and TI.  Every employee I encounter at the Palazzo is always very friendly and helpful.  Check in was once again a complete breeze, as was check out.  We arrived at the Palazzo at about 11am, much earlier than the stated check in time, and they were able to give us a room right away.

I'll give Palazzo the benefit of the small doubt and bump them up to 4 stars, when I really think its a 3.5-ish hotel.

I actually added a friend to the room who got there before I did, so not sure how check in was, but adding her was simple.

In general the hotel is pretty nice, as it should be for the slightly higher price tag. My friends were convincing me to try it (I typically think that you should just go for a mediocre hotel (Mandalay, MGM, etc) because you won't be there much and the prices are great. But this place was worth the extra 25-30\/person or so that we ended up spending. They also told me - which ended up being true - that in the winter you tend to not go to the pools or anything, so chances of being in your room are more likely. We ended up lounging inside one of the days which was great.

Generally the hotel feels very clean and the air isn't very smokey. I'm pretty sensitive to that and none of my stuff came home smelling weird. Also their "smallest" room is a great size - it comes with the skunken living room which is perfect for 2+ people - and is very clean\/comfortable. We had 4 total and 3 could fit comfortably in the bed, while the large l-shaped couch could accommodate 2. I had requested and extra bed online, thinking I needed one, but didn't. (It never showed up anyways) so you could really fit 7ish people in here if you really wanted too. Bathroom is large but the shower is glass so unless you're that close with your friends, bathroom is one person at a time.

All other little things - parking, calling the front desk, etc - were pleasant. Bummer that our check out couldn't be extended (we had to leave at 11) but we ended up beating all the traffic back to LA so it ended up being a good thing.

Would definitely stay here again!

This is a beautiful hotel with beautiful suites. I give them that much. The reason for me giving this establishment 2 stars is because of their horrible room service. We walked into the suite which seemingly looked clean, BUT we found broken glass on the carpet, blood stained sheet on the bed. Called and they brought us clean sheet and vacuumed. Also bathroom smelled like sweat, plus the bedroom bench was stained. The next day we ordered breakfast and talked to John, one of the mangers.  He reassured us that someone is going to come and deep clean the suite. We were happy about that. We went to the pool and came back at 4PM, AND nothing was done.  Before we left for the night, we called for a 3rd time.  When we got back to the room at 10:15 pm, the room was still a mess with the breakfast table in the middle of the room and the blood stained sheet on the floor. Finally Rene from the room service came and cleaned the bathroom and the breakfast table. He was very nice and apologetic.  Thank you Rene. I have stayed here before, but I am not sure that I will again. I have never had this issue at the Aria.

The Palazzo is a fantastic hotel. 
Before I rave about its flawlessness, just one word of caution: the parking lot is pretty vast, and you can get lost.

Now, where to begin? The location, to start off, of the Palazzo is an ideal spot. Across, there is Treasure Island and its revered pirate show. Two minutes of walking will get you to Wynn, which has a nice buffet (see my review on it). The second floor is a long corridor of shops; most are at exorbitant prices... but definitely worth eye-shopping. You can also take a luxurious gondola ride.

The interior. Breathtaking! A lovely Italian design with impressive decor. Very fancy; apropos for its five-star rating. Although I did not personally play in the casino, it seems to be very intimate and more... classy, you know?

We checked in at 5:30PM; unfortunately, the room we reserved was all out. The registar happily upgraded us to a hospitality suite. Mind you, I was quite pissed after realizing it was on sixth floor (compared to the 50, the highest story). My grumpiness vanished when I saw the two-door entrance to my suite, compared to other one-door's. I went in with excitement; my anticipations were met! This room was at least 1 1\/2 times bigger than the "normal rooms," well over the 720 square feet we were promised. Two bathrooms; one is like a hallway, with a personal TV across from the tub, and marbled shower. There was a separate living room and a master bedroom; plasma TV's on both. Amazing, amazing, amazing. And the furnitures were beautiful!
All this for $158 (with resort fee)? Hell yes!

Clean, luxurious, and ample. Love you, Palazzo! Will come back again!

Note: I receive comped rooms at the Palazzo.

I'm not sure what happened in the last year but the room servicing at the Palazzo has gone down considerably. I go to Vegas at least 4-5 times a year and in the last year I've stayed at the Palazzo.

From our first visit in early 2008 to our last visit last month, the rooms are never as clean as they use to be. I assumed it was the economy so they've cut down on the luxury bath soups (by Agraria) and sometimes the room is not as clean as it should be. At first I thought it was a one-time deal but my last four stays were similar in nature.

Since the rooms are comped, I shouldn't really care but I'm going to opt to stay at the Venezia Tower instead. It looks identical to the Palazzo except for the luxury soups (Agraria Bitter Orange).
The rooms were awesome for our family of four.  View was great.  Pool was great.  Loved it

Technically I would give this hotel 4.5 stars because our 4 day stay was absolutely amazing! The Palazzo check-in desk gave us no problem nor an extra charge to check in after our early morning flight. 
You can't do a girls trip without a fabulous view and the Palazzo offered a great complimentary view (no upgrade charges). Every morning we woke up to the Wynn hotel, two pools, wynn golf resort, and awesome mountain views. We chose the bella suite which offered two comfortable queen beds and a plush L shaped couch in a sunken swanky living room. On day 2 we discovered the curtains were automatic as well as the shades, the child in me found this very cool by the way. 
The housekeeping service was five star all of the way! Our room was cleaned to perfection everyday with turn down service.
Be sure to check out the canal shoppes, it offers a variety of high end stores with great restaurants. I found the Palazzo offered a calm scene, a little more rowdy on the weekend, with an amazing waterfall.
The casino was very busy on the weekend, but slower during the day. The crowd is  a mix of cultures who don designer gear, no matter what age.
I have stayed in both the Venetian and the Palazzo and neither will disappoint you!

Giving one star for the customer service, and the steakhouse. The steakhouse was some of the most amazing food my party had ever ate!!!!!! The customer service in this hotel was fabulous too. Everyone was extremely professional and kind. However, our experience with the hotel in general was awful. We checked in early and paid extra for an early check in along with a view of the strip. We got to our room and it was dirty. None of the tables were wiped down, it clearly wasn't vaccumed, water spots in the bathroom, but most importantly the wall next to my bed was covered in either blood, or puke, or a mix of both. I didn't even want to sleep in that bed it made me so sick. Our bags were told they'd take 15 minutes in which we waited almost 2 hours for. When we got our bags we had bought a $20 cooler before check in, that was completely broken. Our case of beer was opened and all the cans had dents, so obviously everything must have fallen over. They brought us a bucket to compensate that was actually pretty filthy. The hotel manager was very kind, and they did a few things for us which we appreciated very much. The staff was honestly great. However, last trip we took to Vegas we stayed at Excalibur for $40 a night, and it was 5 stars in my eyes. Everything was clean, and we had no issues with anything. This was a special trip for us in which we wanted to stay at a "fancy" and more expensive hotel. If we could do it over again, we would have chosen something else. This may not always be the case, because we've heard great things about the Palazzo, but in my opinion, save your money, it was NOT worth it. To pay that kind of money, you expect perfection. Of course everyone makes mistakes, but there is no excuse to a blood covered wall when you walk into your room. Stay at a less popular hotel! Use the extra money to enjoy the strip!!!!!!!!!

The all suite rooms are BEAUTIFUL! 
I love the decor especially.
Want to split the cost with a lot of friends? Ask for 2 beds and a pull out couch and you can maybe fit 9 people in that room.
The staff was very friendly (and I mean overly friendly). I loveddd that it was small compared to other hotels so it doesn't take me 10 mins to get from the parking lot to the room elevators.

If you choose to stay here do NOT forget anything in your room as you will never see it again. I get that between the two towers there are alot of rooms but I went to the front desk as we were checking out and left all my information and what I had left behind in the room as we were running for a cab to make our flight. I asked my property be retrieved and I would pay for it to be shipped back and I was told by the front desk gal that she would send someone to retrieve my belongings, this of course never happened and now my stuff is gone bye bye. How difficult was the task I asked for? After I got back home 2 hours later I called to check back on my items and I got phone transferred to lost and found and also to security with employees promising to look into and call me back, nothing, crickets, they just wanted me off the phone the same as the front desk gal wanted me to go away. I was there for EMC world so I did not pick this place myself but I guess I have minimum expectations not to be lied too or when I ask for something like my property to be retrieved and the employee agrees I expect that to happen. Nope, not a chance. Being large should not mean lies and no service when asked for service. We were there 4 nights and also spent over $1500 on food and drinks at the hotel but this simple request to ask someone to get my property from the room 10 minutes after we walked out of the room as we had left our keys inside the room was too much to ask for from this mega establishment. I will be traveling around for 50+ more years but I wont step foot in this place again, I don't tolerate being lied too and theft of my property. Also most of the worst one star reviews are located under not recommended under these yelp reviews, I read them AFTER my stay and was mortified I had ever slept here, pretty gross. You should definitely read those reviews.

7 scantily dressed girls + 4 full bottles of hard liquor + Vegas = 7 hot messes...all made possible by Palazzo Hotel

3 vanity areas (GORGEOUS), plus 3 additional mirrors to help create the "I'm hot now" look, but the "I'm a tr**ny" look 6 hours later.

2 queen beds, 2 sectional couches (1 with a pull out), perfect to slab a stack of sardines, errr I mean 7 lost and confused souls at the break of dawn.

1 shower to "wake" us up, and 1 bathtub to store 100 used towels.  

1 separate toilet area within the bathroom to ___________________ (fill in the blank).

1 flat screen in the bathroom, and 2 flat screens in the room to... I don't know, check out of the room?  

Ice, cups, and plenty, plenty...plenty of trash containers that will come in handy.  

All of this for $250 (which includes tax) for 1 night.  If you think about the amount of people it fits, it pays off (at least if you're a girl) since you're not fighting for mirror space.  The best part about this location is all the little amenities like the ones I mentioned above.  They also come with two terry robes\/slippers, lots of closet space, an adorable décor.   

How I can recall all this after such a crazy night is beyond me.  The end.

The Palazzo really gives other hotels a run for their money.  When you talk beauty and elegance I can't think of a hotel more fitting to those complements than the Palazzo.  From the minute you enter the parking garage you know your in for a treat.  Upon walking around the entrance and front desk area you feel like you've left Vegas and been transported to Italy or Greece.  The picture art and statue\/fountains are magnificent.  

Now, it's an expensive resort like Wynn, Bellagio, and big brother Venetian, but just like the three deliver a memorable experience from start to finish.  From the garage to the front desk, restaurants, clubs, lounges, gaming, and hotel.  These are "the" resorts you want to save up and splurge on.

We stayed at The Palazzo in mid-August 2009 and didn't want to leave!  There is so much to do there as it's connected to The Venetian.  One of the great things about the rooms at The Palazzo was that you could have friends\/guests over and not feel like you were in a tight little room.  The sunken living room felt like it was away from the bedroom and bathroom area so your friends could sit and talk or watch TV without feeling like they are in your space.  The bathrooms were beautiful and large with a vanity, separate tub and shower and separate toilet area.  The shower was an all glass shower and the flat screen TV in the bathroom could be viewed while you were in the shower or tub.  It was a big deal for husband watching the game.  :) 

The other great thing about The Palazzo was that you didn't feel like you were  walking through an obnoxious casino as you went to your room.  Although the casino was large, with lots of people, it seemed really tame and relaxing.

The worst ever !
I come to Vegas for new year celebration for 15 years never seen that check in takes 4 hours !!

What a gorgeous hotel! A grandeur entranceway so mesmerizing with marble pillars, sky high ceilings and just oh so fancy details and design I had to do double takes just to take it all in. I couldn't stop saying WOW! 

I initially booked a room at the Venetian (they are joined together through the Grand Canal Shoppes) for a weekend getaway. My friends booked at the Palazzo so when I mentioned if I could transfer to the Palazzo to be closer to them with the same room rate, it was no problem, no hassle, very accommodating request. The registration personnel was professional but not snooty, really friendly & made me feel like a VIP.  The bell desk brought up my suitcase just a few minutes after check in so no waiting till forever to receive my belongings. 

My 2 queen beds with spacious loft area  was just so beautiful and the fancy marble bathroom with its double door entrance looked like you were walking in to view a masterpiece. A separate vanity mirror and chaise just for me was very pampering and added a nice touch to the powder room. The shower had 3 water massagers, 1 on top and 2 on the upper sides by the Hot & Cold knobs I felt like I was getting a Vichy shower at the spa.  Very relaxing on the back & shoulders and took off the edge from a 4 hour road trip into Nevada. The overall room was big, spacious and very pretty. 

I signed up for their Grazie card for member promo offerings and to build up points for possible comps.

I am definitely coming back here. Bookings.com provided great room rates and it is obvious their connection to the Palazzo is solid. 

Once in a while it's nice to treat yourself to a bit of luxury and relaxation.  Gosh darn it, you only live once...make it a good one. :)

Very very VERY disappointed!

No, my husband and I will not stay here again, nor will we recommend it to any of our family and friends.

We checked in on Friday at around 6:00pm. We were given the room on 10th floor. The first room that we walked into had towel in the sink, towel in the bathtub, and the water tank for the toilet was open (I was toooooo furious that I forgot to take pictures). We called the front desk for another room and they gave us another room on the same floor. In the other room we had a dirty mop on the counter, trash in the shower, mirror wasn't cleaned, dripping sink, and blue tape holding the wall paper together........ We called the front desk again for a "clean" room preferably on the different floor, and they can only give us the handicap room and we don't want that. So the front desk tells us that they will send the housekeeping manager over to the new room to go through all the cleaning procedures with us and make sure it's all clean. After 30 mins of waiting, no one came. We called the front desk again for updates, and the response was "due to miscommunication, the housekeeping manager thought problems were resolved." So we waited another 10 mins for the housekeeping manager to come. She came, cleaned and pick up the things then left. 

By the time she left, it was 8:30 close to 9:00, so we decide to stay in and order room service. Guess what!? There's NO MENU!! Long story short, by the time we could eat, it was 10:30........

The sleep was not easy either....... The AC has ratting sound, u can hear people opening and closing door..... and u can hear the party that's happening at the group level. 

For a 5 star hotel, we really wasn't expecting this. Especially this is the first experience for my husband at this hotel. Compare to all other 5 stars, 4 diamond hotels we had stayed at, this definitely is a extremely bad experience.

Gorgeous rooms!  Plenty of space.  3 flat panel tvs.  The most comfortable beds you can ever lay your asses on.  remote controlled blinds and curtains.  Impeccable room service.  Gorgeous modern decor.  Gorgeous bathrooms.  And its like 100-200 bucks more cheaper than the Venitian rooms.. Which looks exactly alike!!!!!

Had a very nice stay here with my friends in Vegas.  Large suite with lots of amenities.  Lots of space to put our stuff.  The bed was very comfortable and I fell asleep instantly, basically.

The grounds themselves were very easy to navigate.  There were ample signs, so I didn't feel like I was in a confusing series of rooms with no idea of where to go.  The smoke here was minimal, thankfully, and I could barely tell that people were smoking.  I also didn't feel the heaviness in my chest like I usually do at Vegas casinos.

I would definitely stay here again!

Booked the Venetian.  Slipped the check in agent a $20 and voila, upgrade to the Palazzo.  Despite being further back the rooms were newer and nicer.  Second to the top floor had a great view.  The room was really spacious.  The decor was very modern but still warm and not sterile.  Definitely loved the huge sectional to kick back and lounge on.  If you have a large group, definitely consider staying in one of the suites here.

The walk between the Venetian and the Palazzo is quite long though.  

The pool was alright.  Their version of the pool club was pretty lame for a saturday in September.  We got in for free and were welcomed to a sausage fest.  Pass.  We grabbed a beer, took in the nice view, and then proceeded to leave the "club"  If the pool club vibe is your thing, definitely skip this place and walk on over to Tao Beach and be prepared to pay and or wait.

All in all a great stay.  

One big plus is that you can walk to Bouchon and the Bouchon Bakery!!

Got a great flight\/room deal here for Columbus day weekend. Booked Friday left Saturday morning because spontaneity is fun and maybe I have a little bit of a gambling problem.
