Make sure to become a member of IHG rewards before traveling, even if you book on a third party site. 
I used priceline express deals and got this room for $100\/night and is usually anywhere from $200-$400 (upgraded view room). Look for the 5 star hotel deal on the north end of the strip. Make sure it's the hotel\/casino deal! The deal for just hotel is for Trump (there's no casino in trump).

The Palazzo knows how to do it right. It is a wonderful hotel. Amazing.

The rooms are spacious. The bathrooms in the rooms are spacious. The casino is spacious. The hotel itself is spacious. 

Being on the 41st was nice. The view of the strip is fantastic. It is also nice to be able to see theTreasure Island show from across. 

It may be quite a walk to the middle of the strip, but you can walk nearby to Harrahs and use the monorail! 

I don't want to repeat other fellow Yelpers positive experience (because it's all true) but you should make an effort to stay at The Palazzo when in Vegas. 

Even though I'm fond of The Palazzo, here are some negatives to watch out for:
- I was disappointed with the shower water pressure. Not strong enough. 
- There isn't a vent in the bathroom. 
- Mini fridge... Really?!, I'll get charge for taking the drinks out? So unless your going to drink the drinks in there, I wouldn't take it out. 
- Room service lags  when picking up food carts in the hallway. Having to walk pass 1 day old food in the hall is not fancy at all.  
- My friend received a  special bouquet of flowers and roses. Front desk kindly left a message regarding the special delivery.  When my friend called front desk for it, they told her she didn't have any special package waiting for her. But then when she went to front desk later that night to ask for it again, they magically found her bouquet of flowers and roses...Hmmm, shady, right?! 

But despite the mishaps and all, I'm a fan of The Palazzo and it is definitely better than other hotels in Vegas.

Gorgeous suites and very upscale.  The pools are big and the spa club was wonderful.  This place took care of me quite well by offering 3 free nights, free dinner and gave me over $200 for gambling.  What a deal and of course i'll be back again.

Palazzo is the slightly smaller, more contemporary twin of The Venetian.  In fact, they're connected.  The rooms are nearly identical to those at The Venetian and are just as nice and big.  It's advertized as a five-star resort, but it's so big that it just doesn't offer the personalized service or attention that you would normally expect at a true five-star hotel.  Still, everything is very nice and typical of a high-end Vegas resort casino: casino is nice and open, the mall is very high-end and expensive, there's a good array of restaurant options.  Palazzo is great and its adjacency to The Venetian is a big advantage.  Somehow, though, it's still just a half-notch below Bellagio, which still seems to be atop the heap of high-end casino resorts in Vegas.  You can usually get a good rate here online, which is why Palazzo seems to have a somewhat less upscale clientele than you would normally expect at a place this nice.

I haven't stayed in many hotels in Vegas I've only been there maybe 3 times.  But let me tell you the rooms in the Palazzo are absolutely amazing!  It gives you that feeling "This is what being in VEGAS is all about!!!"  From the color coordination to the furniture, and the flat screens, the bathroom was stunning!  I loved everything about it.  

As you walk in to the left is the bathroom as you go a little further to the left are 2 full beds with a flat screen to the right as you go further there are 2 steps leading down a kind of L or U shaped couch which also has a pull out bed and another flat screen on the right and further a big window with the Vegas Strip View.

The reason I took one star out was because I was absolutely irritated because you had to show your key every time you were on your way to the elevator area.

The Palazzo is fantastic. Stunning is aesthetic, and I've had great customer service experiences during both of my visits. 

The room I had (might have been called a suite) had two queen size beds and a pullout sofa - slept up to 6. Spacious, multiple TVs, area for laptop. We actually watched the super bowl from our rooms because we were so comfortable.

Review for room 03-727 - which i am in right now

Ok so the main hotel beautiful - front desk staff AMAZING! Casino, great, 99% of this hotel is amazing but what makes me drop this all the way down to 1 star?

Well this amazing room come with a private courtyard (which is great during the day).  The problem is when we walked out there at night - roaches -  20-40 of them running all around and on the furniture.  For a hotel of the caliber I can not give this a pass.  This is a simple problem to solve.

I've been here twice this year. The rooms are very nice and extremely large compared to most places. I would have given them 5 stars except for the fact that both times I made reservations, I specifically requested adjoining rooms. Each time, when we get to check in we are told they don't have any adjoining rooms available.  If you are going to offer adjoining rooms for a $40 upcharge, then you need to be able to honor the reservation.  So both times we ended up the people in our party spread all over the place on opposite ends of this ridiculously huge hotel. It is aggravating as all hell. I'm a VIP invited guest too and they still cant get it right. its almost as if the hotel is too large for them to manage. Cocktails at the pool run about $20 and are not very strong either.  Still, I will be returning for sure.
We came here to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and requested the 11:00am check, got up at 5:00am to get on our early flight and we are still WAITING for our room!!!! So frustrating!!!

review for the Bella Suite (non - smoking)

THE +'s: same layout as the venetian suites but more modern style decor (less with the gold scrolls and cherubs). furniture slightly worn but then that's to be expected with any popular vegas hotel. otherwise, housekeeping kept detailed tabs of preferences -- clean sheets -- comfy beds -- comfy pillows. service was always friendly. i paid extra for a strip view and actually got a glittery strip view for once. internet access is billable here which kinda sucks but at 10 bucks per 24 hours, this is actually one of the lower net access charges around the strip hotels. unexpected pluses were the amazing fruity scent that floated everywhere you went (excepting the smoking casino floor of course), and the fact that it's a wonderfully short walk from the room elevators to the valet\/taxi area.

THE -'s: concierge always took forever to answer my calls. i called on a thursday evening at about 11pm to get an extra hypoallergenic blanket. was on hold for nearly 25 minutes before my call was answered. then it took another 2 hours before the blanket was actually delivered. don't know if this was due to the fact that it was near a weekend -- but then i went during the weekend right before christmas and this is usually the slow season for vegas. eh.

SUM: slow concierge aside, i enjoyed my stay here. everything was so elegant and people were always friendly. a real classy place. well worth the price i paid (average 180 a night). if you can get a good price during the off-season, i highly recommend the palazzo.
Poor phone service better by supervisor. Definitely needs mor customer friendly staff.

Driving through Vegas, we booked the Palazzo, even though no one we knew had ever stayed at or even heard of it. And it's great, for the most part. We're in a deluxe suite with a king bed. The staff are very helpful and responsive. But two reasons this isn't a 5 star review: the mini-bar is set up so that if you pick up an item (to read the ingredients or otherwise just check it out), you're automatically charged for consuming it. So, as the front desk and bellman will warn you: DO NOT PICK UP ANYTHING FROM THE MINIBAR UNLESS YOU PLAN TO PAY FOR IT. We're trying not to even look at the minibar, in case it gets any ideas. The other ding on this hotel is that it lacks basic amenities like a fridge where you can stash a bottle (because the one in the room is stocked with bottles and cans that we are afraid to touch, because of the whole weight-triggered-minibar-charge-thing). The concierge offered to try to track one down for us at the cost of $25\/day. No thanks. We're OK with our dessert wine warming up. The same goes for a business center (yes, I know I'm in Vegas--what are these words "business center"? but this is also a big convention location, so bear with me): I just wanted to print out a few pages. Since it wasn't just one sheet, the concierge gave me directions to a FedEx through the casino, past a waterfall, beyond some restaurants and maybe into the next county. Thanks anyway. So all in all, a great hotel. Just not so helpful in ways that I think are pretty hotel 101.

By far, THE BEST hotel I have stayed at in Vegas (and I've stayed at: The Palms, Aria, Venetian, Trump, MGM, Elara, PH). I really enjoyed staying at this place because the stores that I tend to visit and shop at are all near\/in the hotel. Not only that, The Palazzo Hotel only consist of all suits!! That to me is the best perk ever! 

The regular room that I booked was a suit that had a sunken living room, flat screen in the living room, bathroom, and bedroom. HUGE bathroom (separate tub\/shower\/toilet). 

-Room service= great
-Housekeeping = good
-Service = Fast

The bar\/restaurants are classy and affordable. 
I definitely would recommend this place! 100%! 

ENJOY!

As soon as you walk into the Palazzo, you feel captivated.  Take a deep breath and smell the fresh aroma that roams through the hotel - the soft scent even makes the casino portion easy to walk through rather than smelling cigarette smoke.  Valet service was attentive and promptly brought our luggage up.  Check-in was a breeze and the front desk was friendly and helpful.  We were offered a room with the strip view for an additional $45, but we declined.  The gentleman assisting in the end still gave us strip view, facing the T.I. and the pool area free of charge.  

To access your hotel room, you just flash your room card.  When walking to our hotel room, we noticed the carpets and decor which was very chic.  When we walked into our room, everyone was impressed.  The bathroom was very roomy, featuring a full tub and a shower area.  With a bunch of girls in 1 hotel room, it was also good that the toilet area had its own separate door and also nice that there were plenty of mirrors throughout the hotel.  

Our room had 2 queen beds and a living room area.  The beds were comfy and the girls who slept on the pull-out sofa said that it was comfortable as well.  There were 2 flat screen tvs in each area.  The window curtains were controlled by remote.  The layout was similar to the Venetian, but the decor was a notch above.  

Whenever we called the front desk, they always promptly answered, were very professional, and the service received was quick.  Internet costs $10.00 for 24 hours.  The internet was slow - probably slower than dial-up, but that was my only gripe of this place.

The Palazzo is in a great section of the Strip - it's close to the Mirage, T.I., Wynn, and Fashion Show Mall.  It even connects to the Venetian.  This info will serve you well if you are planning on shopping (Palazzo, Fashion Show Mall, Venetian, and Wynn), going to quality restaurants and the better clubs (Tao\/Tao Beach, Jet, Christian Audigier, and Lavo).  With Las Vegas always changing and emerging, at this point in time, this is the more trendy area.  Our whole stay, we primarily walked to all the locations with ease.  With 9 girls in heels, everyone liked the fact that we could walk to Tao and Lavo and back to our hotel room without ever stepping outdoors.

Check-out wasn't working on our tv so I called the front desk and they easily took care of it.  Out of all the hotels that I've stayed at on the Strip, this was my favorite place to stay.  2 nights cost me $818 and was worth the money.  We all loved it and would return in a heart beat!

Came here for one night and it is beautiful! Loved our suite and I have to say that this is the comfiest bed in a hotel that I have EVER stayed at in vegas. I have stayed at Wynn, Bellagio, Vdara, Cosmopolitan, MGM (I come about 8 to 10 times a year) and this bed was the best. I got the best 4 hour sleep LOL. The room was very clean and the staff is so nice. Im 26 and like to stay in hotels not full of crazy young partiers and this hotel is perfect for that. An older crowd and not as crowded as other hotels. Also we flew in and our flight leaves till 7 and they said they will hold our luggage for up to 24 hours. Thats nice! Havent even left and CANT wait to be back.

I used to love this hotel and it used to be my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas but not anymore. 

The front desk made numerous mistakes to our profile upon check in. When we asked to correct them, it took more than one try and more than one phone call. Because of this when my sister tried to charge something to the room, she was treated like a thief. When my sister's key card demagnitized, they gave her a new one but then canceled my key card as well without telling her. It then took over 45 minutes to get security to get me in my room which was a really problem because I was there for work at a convention. I missed part of an important meeting as a result. 

They also charged us for an upgrade they didn't give us. I had to call to get credit for the mistake and that phone call took more than 30 minutes. 

The service at the Grand Luxe in Palazzo side was terrible. It was slow and the waitress couldn't even get the drink order right. 

I completed the customer survey and received an email from Theresa Miranda in customer relations to apologize. She also offered to help with any future stay because of our experience so I thought, what the heck, we were planning to go back for my birthday that is coming up so asked for some rates. It's now been a week and she hasn't responded. 

I would think twice about calling this place a four star or five star hotel anymore.

This hotel is EXQUISITE.  I was here for my bachelorette party this weekend and I loved everything in the room from the bedding to the bathrooms!  Our suite was decked out with 3 TV's (one in the bathroom... So handy for turning on music or just staying entertained while you're getting ready for a night out, etc.) and had a cute office area for those who needed to get a little bit of work done.  

The beds are SO COMFY.  They have these awesome Sealy posturepedic beds that make you feel like you are sleeping on a cloud!  And the sheets... OH THE SHEETS! LIKE BUTTA! LOL.

Pros:
-Beautiful suites
-Amazing room layout (Totally made for partying)
-Comfy beds
-Lots of TV's!
-The Palazzo\/Venetian have the best spas around

Cons:
-A tad bit pricy
-Housekeeping is really hit or miss with requests 
-Views are kind of crappy depending on your room

Tips:
-Use the wireless without fear.... It's not REALLY $15.99; it's included in the resort fee.

I can't believe how great this place was (!!!!)... most certainly a pleasant surprise.  The only reason i didn't flat-out give it a 5 was due to the horrifically long line upon arrival, even though my honey had arranged for premier check-in.  But whatever, because 20-30 minutes later we were on our way to our sweet little suite, and we LLL LOVED it.

Super clean and very well laid out, the room really was quite lovely: i think it was the whimsical elegance of the furnishings and the layout itself that did it. There was a comfy yet refined, eclectic mix that really worked -- heyday vegas elegance with a modern Jetsons twist that -- with the infusion of selected fabrics\/pieces that were so well chosen and splashed -- made me feel as if i were in my own groovy pied-a-terre in Manhattan (sunken living room and all)!!!!

YAY: there's nothing like casual elegance to make you feel relaxed and comfortable, especially if you happen to be in a zoo of sorts.  I'm not really into the whole Disneyland vibe of Vegas (the food and spas and the Barney's that stays open til midnight are juuuust fine though!).......so having such a comfy, quiet, lovely room as a base-camp made our whole stay very, VERY nice.

housekeeping problem...had to call...they didn't follow through at first..called again..they corrected it after a delay..but made it right with credits..be sure to ask..don't just take .' Sorry'  for your reward....boat rides can't always be counted on...due to outside weather...black jack..what do you say...10 hands...they win 9...never busted...speaks for itself...the open sports book in walk through area run by Canters..was quite good...staff super friendly and knowledgeable..can be a wait depending on time..one staff only..great views if you pay for that kind of room....and don't expect comps unless you play a lot...and I mean a lot..
King Suite love love love  the rooms here, excellent service 4of the top Chefs have  restaurants in the hotel an centered on the strip

I came to Vegas for the first time and wanted to spend all my time here, even though I didn't didn't stay at the hotel. It is beautiful as well as the Venetian, but what made me want to be here was the casino. I don't have much to say since I came for a short period of time, and it was my very first time in the casino as well, but I had a great time!
Lol 5 star hotel and sink is clogged with puke coming up. Rude staff offered downgrade on 6th floor. Not staying here again

Kinda hate to write this review because prior to this, the number of reviews for The Palazzo was 777. I only spent time in the sports book, but the Palazzo impressed me from the get go.

The Palazzo is a upscale, professionally run establishment. Everyone here does their job with an amazing degree of pride. The cocktail waitresses, the taxi line staff, the servers, all made the experience for me here.

Good hotel, great room. What really made our trip was the great concierge service we got from Michael Holstrom! He was so friendly, made great recommendations for restaurants and shows and really seemed to care that we had fun.

Claims to be a "green" hotel but you cannot use there refrigerator and do not have coffee makers in room. Went to Walgreens and bought a styrofoam cooler and coffee makers to be disposed of. How's that for green? Beware of removing items from room fridge cause it will automatically charge your room. For some reason the room\/hallway has a faint scent of waffles. The curtains do block out the light which is great.
